Reviews.Title: “Good experience.”
Reviews.Author: hiro h
Reviews.Content: I stayed ParkRoyall on Beach Road for one night. I arrived too early for check in because of the flight schedule. They were not able to let me check in, but offered a refreshment in the 4th floor where they have a SPA and gymnasium. And, I took a shower and rest. And every single person in the hotel was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Volker R
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel online because of the nice pool shown in the photos and were not disappointed at all. Great place to enjoy breakfast at a sunny Singapore morning. Arrived early morning from the airport, got our room right away with a friendly smile from the staff. W`ll come back : - ))

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Parkroyal for 4 nights. I found the standard of the hotel (rooms and service) to be very good. I would recommend the Parkroyal for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: malepilot
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded from deluxe room to orchid club! Staff was very friendly and multi lingual! Swimming pool is very beautiful and clean! Close to the old Bugis quarters with lots of night life! Within walking distance to Bugis Junction and Raffles City! The Room was excellent! Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - not the easiest access with children”
Reviews.Author: Andrew U
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parkroyal on Beach Road with my wife and 2 year old son for our third visit to Singapore. We selected the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, price and hotel amenities, namely the pool. The hotel is clean and the staff are helpful and polite. The deluxe room we stayed in (354) was clean and comfortable and reasonably big for a Singapore room. While the hotel's proximity to Kampong Glam is fantastic, it is a little inconvenient walking to Bugis MRT with a stroller, especially given the construction work around the station. However, it was only a mild annoyance. Another stroller type issue is that the hotel entrance is via about 10 steep steps and the doors are not automatic. The staff were pretty good at opening them and offering to help carry the stroller, but it gets a bit embarrassing after a while. As other travellers have mentioned the pool area is nice and we made good use of it. Housekeeping were efficient and kept the room beautifully. Our only problem really was finding somewhere nearby to have breakfast everyday. While we might have eaten at the hotel we prefer to get out and about. There aren't many places aside from the Toast Box at Bugis or MacDonald's (not our cup of tea) that are open at breakfast time and serve food a two year old child will eat. Probably wouldn't be an issue for most people. All that aside I would definitely stay here again, although my wife said she prefers being closer to the City Hall area.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad place”
Reviews.Author: heidehudini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay. There are just a couple of niggling problems. It's at the moment a bit noisy days and nite, due to new building construction right next to it, but that is just temporary and once it's finished it should be perfect to stay here. The MRT station is a little bit too far for my liking, but the exercise was great! The hotel and staff are fantastic and accommodate all your wishes. Nothing is too much for them to help and make the stay a great one. The rooms and free Internet and the comfy pillows don't want you to,go,out shopping ! All in all great prize great stay and can highly recommend. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Muslim traveller”
Reviews.Author: AizaMuhammad
Reviews.Content: Good location for Muslim travellers (halal food) at Arab Street, 10mins walk to Bugis Junction & MRT. Some of the staff is friendly. Easy to get taxi & bus. Quite area.

Reviews.Title: “Good area and value”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany B
Reviews.Content: It was very clean and the staff were very friendly. Had a good breakfast buffet. Free wifi was a plus. They give you free bottles of water and I thought that was a plus. The pool area is really nice, there is construction going on behind the hotel but I only noticed it while at the pool. Arab street is within walking distance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One honest and good value hotel -- clean rooms and good staff”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong if you are after value and a clean room. The staff are friendly and helpful. In future a MRT subway station will be at the door step which will make getting around the island so much more convenient and faster.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in gorgeous Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AmandaC3
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Incredibly clean on entry and filled with the lush Singapore orchids as expected on arrival. The room was large, well laid out, clean and had everything required, including wireless internet services. Concierge were very helpful and easily arranged day tours, taxis and hints and tips on how best to get around. No problem arranging connecting room with other family members staying next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sara H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days en route to our son's wedding in Australia. We arrived late at night and like another reviewer were not enthusiastic about the bar, because of the loud music.However, the concierge and the porters suggested the Blu Jazz, just over the road, which was excellent. The staff were also incredibly helpful when I had problems with my I Pad, acquired for the trip. The concierge contacted a member of the office staff who solved my problem with cheerfulness and good humour. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run and appointed”
Reviews.Author: benbenton
Reviews.Content: This 30 year old modern hotel lies on the edge of the historic district and next to Arab town. Lovely big rooms, great service and a wonderful large roof-top pool area. Several in house restaurants including poolside dining. Easy walk to some attractions, shopping centers, food courts and metro stations. Ongoing construction next door is the only downside. This is our third stay here in two years.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in Expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: occdoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for your money in expensive Singapore. I stayed for 5 nights at the Orchid Club floor, and got a custom-made breakfast daily, wine and hors d'oeuvres every evening, free laundry for 2 pieces of clothing daily, and free 24-hour wireless internet. The room was average sized but modern, clean and very comfortable. Location was very convenient, with a free shuttle daily to major shopping malls. Decent gym and spa. Very courteous and efficient staff, too! Definitely a wise choice for this city!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Parkroyal on Beach Road”
Reviews.Author: robjan01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had 36 hours in Singapore and had an overnight stay at the Parkroyal on Beach Road. We have stayed here many years ago and didn't really enjoy it that much as it was only an overnight stay, and my wife missed out on her shopping.The checkin was very smooth and helpful. The GREAT thing about the Parkroyal is its proximity to Suntec City...a large shopping complex, only a 15 minute walk. Also only 15 minutes to Little India and many reastaurants.On saying this it's a taxi ride to Orchard Road for serious shoppers. My wife found most her likes in Suntec. The room was very comfortable and seemed to have been refurbished, FREE WIFI is a REAL Bonus (there is a cable in the room for Internet at no charge also).The breakfasts were good but needs some improvements.Scrambled eggs were very soggy and pre done. Fruit display was tired looking and not replenished adequately,nice touch is a coffee/cappuccino maker only 1 machine was working at the time though. Checkout was again fast and efficient with a pleasant smile. OVERALL...We would highly recommend the Parkroyal and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with good value”
Reviews.Author: 3mt1
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 1 day trip to singapore, the hotel was easy to find and near the arab quarter just at the opposite, so it's quite lively in the night if you're bored and don't wanna go too far from the hotel. room is quite normal but comfy with complimentary internet which is quite fast. Breakfast was normal with good selection of food. Check-in process and check-out process is a no hassle and service is quite good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Family Travel”
Reviews.Author: Inder_matta
Reviews.Content: Our Tour Operator booked this hotel for our family holidays and I was not sure what to expect from this hotel. However I was surprised when we reached there, as they did quick check-in and provided excellent service and ensured that we have room quickly so that we can have some rest. The best part was the breakfast as my kid is fussy and to my comfort they had huge selection of breakfast and that ensured that my kid was well feed in the morning. This hotel is close to Mustafa center and good if you want to do any shopping nd have some Indian food around. Overall worth a stay for our family holiday with good mix of shopping, food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring, bland & tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephenLock
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it is a member of the Global Hotel Alliance (of which I am a black card holder) and I am frankly perplxed as to how this hotel became a GHA member as it really isn't up to the usual standards of GHA hotels. On the upside, the staff are friendly and helpful and service levels are good. My room was small, very tired and in need of a good deep clean. Sheets were not as clean as they should be and the carpet is past its best. The internet router, stuck to the wall above the desk with sticky tape, was hanging off the wall. The glass-fronted wardrobe has an automatic light that wouldn't switch off until, at 3am having tried to sleep with it on, i managed to jiggle the door sufficiently for the trigger to go off. So I counted the first night as a FAIL. There is a busy little bar on the ground floor which has a live band and a popular dancefloor with the mostly package tour crowd. it's very noisy and the last place I'd want to go for a nightcap or meet anyone. It's more pub than hotel bar. Breakfast on the executive floor was included in my rate. It's a pretty mean affair as hotel breakfasts go. As I went to get a glass of orange juice, I tried *five* glasses first before I got one that was clean: the first four were frankly filthy, which suggests that the dishwasher on the 6th floor kitchen needs servicing. Overall I think cleanliness an issue at this property. This shouldn't be a GHA hotel, in my opinion and I won't be staying there again. In truth, though, I think all the GHA hotel members to be disappointing and, unusually for GHA, far from the best in the city

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: FileST
Reviews.Content: Lokation of hotel is not so close to interesting parts of Singapore. Near is Buggis metro station, so you can go easy with metro around Singapore. Rooms are nit so clean, much dust, bath is ok and clean. Beds not so comfortable. Can not open the windows. Hotel is overpriced for this location and tipe of rooms. We had deluxe room, and it was average...

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeOz
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Leaking air conditioning that dampened the carpet in our room. The porters forgot to collect our bags from the room for check out, after we had called them and waited 20 minutes. When we checked in, I presented our hotel voucher and the lady said she didnt need to see it but when we arrived in our room, shortly after, the front desk called and asked me to come down asking for a copy of the voucher. Positives: Comfy bed, housekeeping consistent, friendly staff, free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to Arab Street”
Reviews.Author: Sydsider
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel in a convenient location in Singapore. Rooms are spacious and well-appointed with modern bathrooms and firm but comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet is extensive, though I found the quality average, with nothing particularly memorable. Concierge was very helpful with finding a tailor for women's clothes open on a Sunday. Front desk staff were also pleasant. The pool is large and clean, with a Balinese theme around it. Building work going on next door is a pity, but not too noisy or intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a number not a person”
Reviews.Author: Staghunt
Reviews.Content: Very Comfortable, clean and efficient hotel. However I felt as we were just being processed through. Is it because of the numbers of one night stopovers Singapore gets? I found it very expensive but that reflects Singapore as a whole now. I would still reccomend this hotel as it provides what it is supposed to and it is within walking distance of Orchard road. I was in Singapore in the 1970s, in the fun days when it was scruffy and interesting, I have been back a few times and even spent a week there as a tourist. It is now manucured to within an inch of its life, its sterile, expensive and dare I say it boring. There are other Asian destinations to visit

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for one night”
Reviews.Author: Easy_Farva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ParkRoyal on Beach Road for one night while I was passing through Singapore on business. I chose the hotel as it was close to my company's office and was easy to get to from the airport downtown area. While the hotel was fine for what I needed (a place to sleep for a few hours), it wasn't anywhere I would seek out to stay again. It was very run of the mill and didn't really have much of a wow factor to it at all. In saying that the room was comfortable enough and seemed clean. The breakfast was also a bit of a let down and wasn't worth SGD $38.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: klkh2002
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Parkroyal. After my last visit, I was quite happy to return. My last review described it as a gem on Beach Road and nothing has changed. The staff in the hotel are really welcoming and friendly. The rooms on the club floor are very comfortable. I booked ahead and got a great rate - I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: licia_flo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice on the way to Thailand and I enjoyed my stay very much. The rooms are quite and the beds are really super comfortable. You may want to ask for a room with shower (unless you like the bathtub) as the shower is really big and nice. There is a business centre next to the reception where you can print your boarding pass. And the swimming pool is worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, except for the paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Zyen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice ambience, a welcoming aura, and the service was quite good. The hotel also has a security feature where only guests are able to access only their room floors by means of tapping their key card on the reader in the lift. We tried the room service once at midnight and the delivery was prompt and the food was tolerably good. There is also complimentary Internet service, both via wifi and via cable. I was able to connect on my smartphone, as well as my netbook. My friends and I had booked two rooms, but oddly they did not place us on the same floor; we were assigned a room on the 3rd floor, and another on the 4th floor. And the thing is, the room on the 4th floor had a connecting door to the adjoning room, and I don't know why they did not reserve both rooms for us when we had made the booking at the same time. We decided not to kick a fuss though as the room next door was evidently in use. My major complaint is that the walls were very thin. When I took a nap in the afternoon, I could actually hear the doorbells being rung in OTHER rooms, which was very disturbing. And the afternoon I took a nap, the bells were continuously being rung as one of the other rooms on the same floor had kept asking for extra towels/pillows/etc - I know this because housekeeping rung my bell once by mistake (he was supposed to go to the room OPPOSITE mine). I could also hear the people in the room next to mine talking sometimes. For some reason, at night it didn't seem to be as bad as during the afternoon. Personally speaking, I wouldn't come back to the hotel again as I can find other hotels with the same excellent service and thicker walls at the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return”
Reviews.Author: Roy S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a number of times over the past 12 months, ranging between one and five nights, and continuoulsy find the overall service professional and friendly. Quick and efficient check in & out, clean spacious and well serviced rooms, good firm king size bed, good wi-fi/internet connection, prompt room service, good general dining with wide variety at the in-house Brasserie (I haven't tried the restaurant), and courteous efficient staff throughout. Plenty of food choice just across the road in the Arab Street area. Generally well serviced by taxis for trips to/from the CBD, Airport, tourist attractions, etc. Value for money and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best impression”
Reviews.Author: MrsJonesJnr
Reviews.Content: This was the second stop on a multi-stop holiday & its true what the say about never getting a second chance to make a first impression. We arrived early on Christmas Eve (0700), however, despite our travel company booking our room for the prior night so we would have somewhere to sleep after a long night flight, we had trouble checking in. The reason being that we had been put down as no-shows! This seemed (to us) to have put a black mark against our name, as we've never experienced such a poor check-in service. Staff appeared to not know what to do about it, although we were the only ones at the check-in desk with 3 staff trying to work out what they should do was very strange. Once we were finally checked in, we were pointed in the direction of the breakfast buffet & the lifts - no offer of porter service. Also, our travel company had tried to contact the Hotel from June onwards regarding booking dinner for Christmas day; they never received a response. So when we tried to explain this & asked if there was anything available, we were told that they were full & our only option would be room service! As we were only 2, we would have thought that they could've attempted to squeeze us in, early or late. However, our saving grace was Jimmy on the Concierge desk. He was able to ring around & found us another hotel, which offered the same buffet style dinner, but was able to squeeze us in. Interestingly, whilst we were at the other hotel having our dinner, we noticed that they kept adding extra tables even though they were extremely busy... I guess they had happy customers. Location was fine; the Hop-on Hop-off bus stops just across the road which was a lovely thing to do on Christmas day. As we walk a lot, we walked to Raffles & Suntec City regularly, so no issues there. We have stayed in much better hotels & much worse. Not many complaints about the hotel decoration etc. The Concierge desk is the saving grace for this hotel, the rest of the staff were a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly spacious”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week, booked through Agoda and got a cheap rate (200SGD per night). Upon arrival I was upgraded to the next category of room (Premier). Would certainly recommend going for this class of room as the Superior class is apparently on a smoking floor. Compared to hotels in Chinatown, you get a very spacious room (think mine was 32sqm, 20sqm is the norm in Chinatown and some other areas). Hotel itself is modern, clean, and has plenty of facilities. Shame about the building work which makes the pool area a little noisy, but that can't be helped. I didn't hear any building noise in my room as I faced the road at the front of the hotel. Staff were very friendly and happy to help. King sized bed was comfy and all other room facilities were absolutely fine. The area of the hotel is good, near to Arab Street so plenty of food options and bars, and walking distance (5-10 mins) to Bugis MRT station, where there's plenty of food and shopping, along with easy transport options to the rest of the city. I'd say at the price I paid, I couldn't ask for better value. Having stayed in other hotels in Singapore that charge 200SGD per night, this is miles ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: agus_k_chandra
Reviews.Content: Breakfast had lots of variety. I really like it. I got room with view of next building...not really nice but it's okay. Close to my regional office..

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: swalee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkroyal Beach Road for 1 night on a Singapore Stopover in late January. Location of the hotel is not the greatest but it is not far from the Hop on Free Bus (on a Singapore stopover)which takes you to other areas. We found the room and corridors of the hotel needed very much updating. Our bed was the HARDEST bed we have ever encountered but found the staff to be excellent...when we made a complaint about the bed they added a padded quilt which enabled us to have a good nights rest. We enjoyed the extensive buffet breakfast and beautiful swimming pool. We also thought it was overpriced for a Category D hotel on the Singapore Stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: threezacrowd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkroyal on Beach Road after trying numerous other hotels, which were all booked. The location was not great, not really walking distance however it was only a 5 minute taxi ride to Orchard Road. We were extremely impressed with the service we received. We stayed on the Orchard Club Floor, where afternoon tea was provided, with an open bar. Breakfast was also available on the floor which was great, like your own private buffett. Room was nice and clean. Hotel facilities were excellent - massive pool, gym, a number of restaurants, large foyer etc. We would recommend this hotel if you don't mind being out of the action a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mr_F_Germany
Reviews.Content: Not exactly cheap but very clean, great rooms, right next to the Arab quarter (nice but drinks are expensive S€8.00 for a small bottle of beer and 10 for glass of wine and 10 mins walk from Little India (S€5.00 big beer). Also a cool mini-Chinatown I between the 2 with great food malls at S€3 to S€5 for stunning food. Again, beer only S€5.00 a big Tiger beer. Summary? A great hotel in a cool location.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice to be in Park Royal on beach Road.Near to lot of places of Business interest, shopping and tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: prakashOman
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, stay and food was nice, service also good.Hotel is very near to Suntec singapore for business meetingand conferance, walkable distance

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: alison p
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Lovely rooms, lovely pool area. Drinks by pool where a bit expensive. Water bottles in your room every day. Felt very safe walking around. Breakfast was about 28? A lot to choose from. First day or two mrt (underground train service) was a bit of working out. After that we had it all sorted. Make sure you get your refund for ticket, place it back in machine where you bought ticket and it will refund a dollar. It was about a 8-10 minute walk to bugis mrt. You can get to most things by hopping off one and getting on another coloured track. We did catch taxi sometimes, it worked out cheaper. Be careful though, b4 9.30 approx and after 5.00, i think they charge extra. but again not too much. Concierge were very helpful. The doorman even got a umbrella for us, because it decided to bucket down for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Business Visit”
Reviews.Author: ShaileshMamidwar
Reviews.Content: The visit was for 3 days in Singapore. Hotel is very convenient for stay as it really close to business area in Singapore. The staff was good but the services are expensive as per the rates they charge. Overall I enjoyed stay there at ParRoyal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value if you get it at a good price”
Reviews.Author: DanoCanada
Reviews.Content: We’ve been to Singapore over 10 times in the last 8 years. This year, we have stayed at the Wangz, the Albert Court Village and the Park Royal on Kitchener and this is one of the best in its price range. Granted we got it at a fantastic price, almost 50 per cent off on Agoda, so my comments have to be taken in that light. Of course, our long-time favourite, the New 7th Storey Hotel, is no longer available and we have yet to find anything that comes close to it for value and convenience. I realize that the above hotels are not in the same category and we’re still looking for a replacement for that hotel in an affordable price range. But the Park Royal on Beach is a comfortable, clean, convenient place to stay if you can get it for a good price. It does not warrant the rack rate of $250+, but is very good value at the $120 to $150 range. Pluses: 1. Room size: The rooms are much bigger than at the Albert Court Village and this was the main reason we switched over. It also has a mini fridge and very comfortable bed. 2. Service: We got excellent service from the doormen right up to the General Manager. Everyone was courteous, helpful, and responsive. Even upgraded our room without our asking, but we preferred the layout of the regular room because of the work desk configuration. We needed two work stations and they even provided an extra chair. 3. Restaurants: There are two, but we only ate one meal there because I wasn’t well, but the food was good. Because of my illness I asked them if they could warm up a special dish that a friend had provided to help with my recovery and they agree without any problems. Prices are very high by S’pore standards, however. 4. Location – This is a great location close to the MRT (metro) and with lots of shopping options (Bugis Junction, Bugis Village, Sun Tec mall, technology malls, Little India) and it’s right across the street from Arab Street and lots of restaurants. 5. Free wifi was included in our room. 6. Great pool – best we’ve seen in S’pore 7. Business centre: We had free access to for printing and scanning of documents for limited number of pages. 8. Free shuttle to several key downtown locations 9. Free daily newspaper 10. Quiet except for construction noise (see below) Negatives: 1. Noise: We only had one complaint and that was about a persistent noise that started at 7 a.m. and continued late into the evening at irregular intervals. It sounded like someone dragging a table across the floor above us. It was only a minor irritation, but because we were working in our room we wanted to try to have it stopped. Senior management responded promptly to our complaint on two separate occasions but they were unable to find the source of the noise. It was only as we were leaving on our last day of 6, that the door of the room opposite opened and we saw two workmen in the room running cable. That may have been the cause of the noise, but management had never found it. Full marks to them for trying, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good business-hotel”
Reviews.Author: Airjohn
Reviews.Content: The highlight in the modern spacious room was the very comfortable bed. Also very nice swimming pool and garden on the roof. Very nice breakfast with a huge variety! Location is nice, close to the "old part" of Singapore

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: HollyB_oz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Royal on a number of occasions due to its proximity to our office. I find the staff friendly and the service is good. The restaurant offers an excellent buffet selection and the pool is great. Some of the rooms are a bit drab, but I think they are going through a refurb. Will be non-smoking throughout from June 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Executive style”
Reviews.Author: jules838
Reviews.Content: Currently enjoying a 4 night stay here on our way back home from the cold in Europe. Enjoying the benefits of the Orchid Club lounge, great food, lovely wine and beer and service that is efficient and professional without being obtrusive. Would recommend this hotel for a stopover and well worth selecting the Orchid Club package. Rooms are reasonable in size, bathrooms very well appointed and the staff friendly and hard working. Breakfast is a combination of Western and Asian dishes and a great way to prepare for a day of walking and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel, Nice Pool, Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lacepede
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay was most enjoyable during mid November, 2011. We travelled as a group to attend the World Orchid Show which was held in the Convention Centre at the new Sands Hotel & Shopping Complex. Just a Sg $7 taxi fare. An older hotel but maintence has been kept up to date. Our room was a good size, well furnished, and very clean. The buffet breakfast was outstanding, high quality and variety. The tropical fruit was special and to complete the buffet there was a chocolate fountain with marshmellows. The large swimming pool looked magnificent and the two times we went up for a swim we were not allowed in the water due to the late afternoon downpour with lightening being considered unsafe for swimming. There is a bar and lounges beside the pool. Little India is a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Irene C
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding there. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Food was great and our wedding dinner was a success. We don't have to worry anything as the Banquet Associate, Mr Husni is always there to help us through. Cosy place and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Hotel Stay & Accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: This Hotel offered excellent facilities & accomation.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: Dilip B
Reviews.Content: value for money and certainly will stay again. unfortunately I don't visit Singapore again. my stay was too short to avail of all the facilities and visit places in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed again.”
Reviews.Author: frumpy33
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to stay again for 2 days before a creuise at the Park Roya.This time we had a different couple with us who agreed that this place is lovely, So handy and the staff helpful and friendly. Rooms always clean and serviced to an excellent standard. We cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: yuko a
Reviews.Content: I had a good time during stay in this hotel. The service was good and this hotel is located in very convenient area and cozy. There are lots of nice cafe and restaurant infront of the hotel. All staff was helpful and friendly so much. I liked the cafe at 4th floor as there is so peaceful. However room cleaning was so so.Sometimes the floor was not clean. Whenever I visit Singapore, I always stay at this hotel.I think they have a good cost performance. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: beachykeen70
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered free wifi and a huge breakfast selection (eggs to order, although on our 3rd morning the cook was undercooking fried eggs and had no idea what a poached egg was). Not often you can choose from pizza, salads, Asian soups or even a chocolate fountain from the same breakfast buffet! The pool was lovely, and was not too busy even though the hotel seemed full. In terms of location, the hotel was close to Bugis Junction; and we walked from the Hotel to Raffles and then we walked to Clarke Quay from there. (although it was a reasonable distance in the heat......but it was doable). I would be happy to stay here again, although would personally prefer to be closer to Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: Trisara01
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive club room which was spacious well appointed and comfortable. The Club facilities were good and the service from the staff was outstanding. in particular, the wi fi throughout the hotel was excellent. Hotel is well located and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Wanyi T
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night at this hotel and liked it very much. The gentleman at the Reception Counter was friendly, efficient and polite. I was upgraded to a room on the 6th Floor where the Orchid Lounge is so I defintely received value for money. Room was clean, well furnished and relatively spacious. Free Internet was a bonus. Even though the room faced a main road, it was quiet. Location was convenient - a short walk across the overhead bridge led to a variety of interesting small shops and cafes. Worth exploring for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: rajiv91
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel more than 4 times, and still love going back.Location wise, it is quite convenient for tourists looking to hop on MRT for a quick ride to Orchard Road or Little India. Rooms are spacious and comfortable.Breakfast is excellent and so is the swimming pool.It is also quite close to the beaches at East Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, great location, beautiful deluxe rooms”
Reviews.Author: Erik S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room, and were delighted with the design and cleanliness of the room. The bed was very comfortable and the staff were fantastic. Free high-speed wireless internet in our room was also a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay on the Club floor”
Reviews.Author: Sandy H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 nights in a room on the Club floor, which meant that we could check in and out on the Club floor instead of at the main downstairs reception, and we had the use of the Club lounge facilities. This allowed us to choose whether to have breakfast in the main breakfast area or in the smaller Club lounge. We chose the lounge as it was much smaller and quieter and still had a good range of food. We could also have free tea and coffee throughout the day in the lounge which was great when returning tired from being out and about. Wonderful 'cocktails' every day from 6-8pm: free wine or spirits, very good range of canapés and so on. Booking a Club room is more expensive but we thought it was worth it for the excellent service and facilities. The room itself was nice, a good size and we had no problems at all with noise. We loved the pool which has an almost Balinese feel about it. Didn't use the gym but it looked excellent. The only criticism is re the internet which was often slow or dropped out. Location is just opposite the Arab Street area and within walking distance of Bugis Junction.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: zmyusof
Reviews.Content: I got quite a good deal from booking.com for this 2D 1N stay which is for room only without breakfast. I was given a room facing this on going construction works adjacent to the hotel which can be a disturbance if you plan to stay in the room during the day. Since I am only there for 1 night, I didnt border asking for a room change but if you are particular about this sort of things make sure you ask for a room facing the main road. Overall the room is acceptable. It even comes with free internet access. No problem for wired connection but the wireless connection may not be the best. Mine was rectified with the installation of a router in the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, disappointing decor, amenities and food.”
Reviews.Author: Lynda S
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the hotel were ok, as the lobby is quite nice, looked pretty and had a pleasant Christmas aroma. We were told in the lobby that we were being upgraded for no reason, hence we thought the lady was nice and we were looking forward to seeing the better room. However, when we opened the door to our room the first thing we felt was disappointment. The room was supposed to be a Deluxe, however it was very plain and depressing. The tv was small, as was the bathroom, however the bathroom was ok and not old fashioned. The food we had at breakfast and then one dinner (both buffet) was a mixed bag. Some of the food was ok, but only because you can't really go wrong with that kind of food, such as fruit, cheese, bread etc. The food such as main dishes and desserts was poor and the cocktails didn't taste like normal cocktails do. The gym was very well equipped, however the equipment appeared to be from the 90's. On a positive note the treadmills had a nice view of the pool as opposed to gyms where the treadmills had no view. The outdoor area by the pool was pleasant and the pool was ok, however next door is a construction site, hence there was a lot of noise and consutruction smells when at the pool, which was unpleasant. Now to the staff, they are probably the saving grace of this hotel, as they are of a high standard, very friendly and courteous. It's almost as if the staff are too good for the hotel and the out of date decor and food let this hotel down. Excellent customer service, poor standard hotel. On a final note, this hotel was very busy during out stay, hence we believe despite our opinion, it is a popular hotel. We will not stay here again, however if the staff were in a new Parkroyal with improvements made, we probably would.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location close to Bugis Junction”
Reviews.Author: Makanan
Reviews.Content: We booked the Weekend package online for two nights while en route to Bali, this being the first time we had stayed at this particular hotel in Singapore. On check in, to our surprise, we were given a complementary upgrade to a Deluxe room by the friendly staff. Our room was on the 4th Floor, and looked out onto the construction area at the back. Contrary to a couple of previous reviews, we were not disturbed by either the lighting or any noise from the building site during our two day visit. The internet access was also fast and stable. We found the pool/bar area, on the same floor, very pleasant, deceiving large and attractively laid out. One of the strengths of this hotel is it's convenient location to Arab Street (lots of little restaurants and bars), Bugis Junction/Bugis Street/Bugis MRT and for the techno nerds, Sim Lim Square, and of course Little India, with it's great selection of Indian food for all budgets. Overall, we would recommend this hotel highly, and will have no hesitation about staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “First time at this hotel, quite impressive”
Reviews.Author: Achikiri
Reviews.Content: I have read comments about this hotel before going, however, I think all those comments are quite old or may be the hotel has already improve their services/qualities after receiving it. The WiFi in the room is considered faster than other hotel that I visited before. In any case, I feel that their single bed is a bit small so I did not have a good sleep on my first visit but it is not hotel mistake as my assistant did not make a request in advance. In any case, hotel has already promised to reserve King-Size bed for me next time, let's see.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at ParkRoyal”
Reviews.Author: minghui79
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at ParkRoyal on Beach Road during one of my weekend retreats after reading about the reviews on tripadvisor.com. The hotel is located within close proximity to 2 MRT Stations each between 5-10 minutes away. It is also next to Arab Street and the Golden Mile Hawker Centre where authentic local food could be found in abundance. Ray who attended to my check-in procedures was professional and helpful. He was kind enough to upgrade me to a club room at level 6 of the hotel. My room 645 was located towards the end of the building. While it did not face the busy Beach Road, it opened straight to a construction site. However, given the very good sound insulation of the room, I wasn't affected at all even though workers were seen working on a Sat afternoon. My room was spacious and very well maintained. The toiletries was very well stocked. All the lightings in the room worked well and overall, I had a comfortable stay since I spent most of my time in the room to rest. However, the cable TV could benefit from more selection of mandarin and English movie channels. I didn't find the staffs at level 6 to be particularly friendly compared to the staffs at the check-in counter. The same applied to the bell-boys who wasn't smiling as well. However, I was quite impressed by the attentive service of the restaurant staffs. During breakfast service, one of the nice ladies would go around the tables asking if I would like a coffee or tea refills again and again. Breakfast was a happy affair where there was a nice selection of buffet items. Was also impressed by the well-maintained swimming pool at level 4 of the property. Again the staffs could be more inviting though. Overall, my staycation at ParkRoyal was a pleasant one. Nice rooms, nice pools and nice breakfast. Most of the staffs I met were nice with a few exceptions. I would still stay here again in future for the great rooms and nice prices I paid. Keep it up. Roy

Reviews.Title: “Light up the night”
Reviews.Author: Gitane48
Reviews.Content: Having booked well in advance and specifically stating both via email and phone that a visit to Singapore was a surprise stop over in route to Jakarta to have a celebrate my partner's birthday. Checking in was handled with indifference with little or no interest shown in my basic request of providing a room with improved view. Upon opening the door to the club room on the 7th floor we were greeted with the intense spot lights from the neighboring construction site cranes to the east. This was solved by simply closing the drapes, but the continued noise of building materials being moved thru out the late night and early morning was somewhat disturbing. In bringing this to the attention of the club lounge staff the response was "they shouldn't be doing that at night". That being said all other aspects of the stay were adequate. As previously noted, location, gym, club service all very good. Having traveled for many years I always kept my expectations in check, giving the property and staff the benefit of a doubt. This stop over visit was as expected. Nothing really stood out in terms of the hotel or staff, all for the most part well trained and cordial. On the next stop over will get assurances that the construction work is completed or evening work is suspended before booking this property again. Please may this inquiry if booking the east facing club rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chice”
Reviews.Author: snapper72
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our experience at this hotel. Of special note--ALL staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool/ bar very well done. The Chinese restaurant--fantastic would have like to return several times. Location across the road from Arab Street and close to rail stations. Bonus for me was a good number of fishing/ angling shops with lots of stuff to pick over.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Royal many times and always find it clean and the staff very friendly. One of the highlights of the hotel though would have to be a swim and a massage to the great pool facility.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to club room.”
Reviews.Author: fraggerz
Reviews.Content: On check in I joked if an upgrade was possible since it was my birthday weekend trip from Australia, at the time the staff member didn't say anything. When he gave me my room key he then informed me I was in the club rooms! So a very pleasant surprise. Location wise I liked it - its not the beating heart city centre, but its near "Arab street" which I liked, regardless - being Singapore and compact, public transport and taxis are fine, so it was only a 5-10 rides to the heart of the CBD, Marina Bay Sands, and also short hop to the airport. Room was very nice and extremely comfortable. There is a glass window in the wall between the bed and bathroom (there are curtains that can be drawn) but could be a bit weird for some. Club facilities was very nice, really enjoyed the canapes and drinks. Breakfast was nice, with a good selection and the chef to cook your eggs/omlette/pancakes as requested. Staff prompt and helpful. Let me borrow a laptop to access some documents so they could be printed off etc. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: LeeBee79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 3-5 Dec'11, the room was very clean much to our delight. The staff was very helpful and service was great. Definitely recommended if you want a clean/comfy room to rest in after a long day outdoor. There are plenty of restaurants across the street, opposite the hotel but most of them are open only for lunch/dinner. Not much options for breakfast if you do not take the hotel breakfast. Overall an excellent hotel to stay. The last night, we decided to have light meal at a Chinese restaurant in the hotel and was surprised by the pricey small cup of tea and tidbits (which we thought was complimentary). Should have known better about hotel restaurants. Just take note if you plan to dine there.

Reviews.Title: “Rock hard mattress, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: igotthis
Reviews.Content: Was put up at the Park Royal on Beach Road for a course. The staff are lovely and very helpful, and the food is pretty good. Unfortunately, my mattress was almost solid, and the walls were very thin. I could hear the person next door cough. And that's not an exaggeration.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay at this centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madwife59
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from 9 nights stay at this hotel whilst visiting my sister who lives in Singapore. Excellent location with easy access to all the major attractions. The hotel facilities such as the breakfast resturant and bar, the roof top pool and spa were execellent. The staff couldn't do enough to help and were polite and accomodating. The army of cleaners keep the place spotlessly clean. The hotel is opposite Arab Street and all the middle eastern resturants serving arabic style food. It is very easy to get to all the major attractions as the local bus stops immediately outside the hotel and only costs about $1.50 to get any where. The Tube is on Nicoll Highway which also within easy walking distance of the hotel. Or you can use the hotel curtesy mini bus that will drop you off the main attractions and shopping Malls. There is a schedule of stops- ask the conceriege for the timetable. It is an easy walkig distance to the many resturants that serve cheap local foods. You can even walk to Raffles and have a very over priced Singapore Sling! Overall an execllent value for money stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Singapore hideaway”
Reviews.Author: AandLabroad
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and well appointed rooms, well maintained and serviced in a great location close to Little India and not too far from anywhere really. The pool and it's bar lounge is a gem and a great place to relax after a big day out in the tropical heat. We didn't eat in the hotel - too many choices close by to savour a more traditional asian experience, so can't comment about dining although we did have tapas style snacks in the pool bar/lounge and this was quite good if not a little limiting in choice. The staff were efficient and polite, if not a little sterile (the doormen are very frinedly and helpful though). The only problem I've had was no hot water on an earlier trip and no apology or compensation, but subsequent visits were all fine. We have stayed here several times over the last few years enroute to Europe, and we don't even think about other hotels in Singapore. Overall a wonderful place to retreat to in a hot city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Stilwell
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel on the same road as Raffles. We stayed in a room that was in the Orchid Club and this is well worth it if you can get a deal on line. It has it's own calm and relaxed breakfast area that starts mornings off in a very civilised way. We booked and paid well in advance making the room affordable to European tourists (and cash-strapped Brits in particular). The facilities are good including restaurants, bar, outdoor pool/bar (when not raining!) and well equiped gym. The concierge staff were particularly helpful as this was our first stay in the city. The only slight downside is that the hotel is a 10-15 min walk to nearest Metro station (Bugis or Nicholl), which can seem a long way if it's hot and sticky or raining. The hotel is on the airport side of the city centre and a taxi is almost as cheap as two people on the "courtesy" bus provided by the airport. If you can get an on-line deal to make it affordable, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel for a Stopover”
Reviews.Author: OzSooty
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Park Royal on Beach Road and the fact we return speaks for itself. We once again stayed in a room with access to the Orchid Club lounge and this is an excellent option. The hotel room itself is spacious as is the bathroom, and the bed is excellent. Amongst other benefits, Orchid Club access provides two free laundry items a day per person and from 6:00pm - 8:00pm the Orchid Club has free drinks and nibbles. In the mornings the full buffet breakfast is available downstairs, but we found the selection in the Orchid Club to be more than sufficient, including cooked to order eggs, omelettes, etc. If you are travelling as a family, be aware that children are not permitted in the Orchid Club. As I have commented in a previous review, while the hotel is not in the centre of the Singapore, it is only a short taxi ride to the main shopping district or to restaurants in Marina Bay, Clark/Boat Quay, Little India, Chinatown etc. And the Arab quarter is just across the road. The hotel has a great pool area, however, a few umbrellas or additional shady spots would be welcome. The poolside menu seems to have been revamped since our last visit, and it now provides a broader range. This encouraged us to eat poolside one evening which was very casual and relaxing - and undercover if it rains.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Jacinta R
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay immensely. Nice rooms, spacious and clean. Nicely appointed. Didn"t eat at hotel given all the interesting options. Close to malay and indian quarter and not too far from esplanade. Easy taxi to orchard rd or sentosa. Friendly staff. We has an issue with a tour we booked from Australia and they sorted it all out for us quickly and were happy to help. Pool area was great. We thought it good value given we needed 2 adjoining rooms. So our experience was all good. Would syay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Yuko2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of 2010 for a week, in a club room with an extra bed. The room is just for 2 people and if you add an extra bed, not much space was left. The club room had privilege of free laundry, free afternoon snacks ( a substantial one ) with free drinks. WiFi was free ( maybe for club rooms only ) but the reception was not good unless you are close to the lobby. The location of the hotel is a bit far from the center and the nearest metro station was in 10-15mins walk distance. If you are young you can walk this much but it usually rains suddenly and sometimes it kept raining, then by the time you reach to the station you are totally wet. Taxis were not expensive and to use buses, you have to know the route well. I suggest that if you are in Singapore for shopping, food, you should definitely stay on Orchard road or around Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Flynn7331
Reviews.Content: We return to this hotel regularly as it is away from the main shopping stretch and in an interesting location close to the arab and indian areas. Good quiet stopover. Our room was large, clean, comfortable and quiet. Had a minor problem with insufficient hot water in the shower during the day, tho OK at night. Also as we were at the far end of the hotel, Wifi was poor. An in room wifi hub was installed for us when we complained. The buffet breakfast is good, including asian and western options. The in house chinese restaurant (Si Chuon Dou Hua) is good (see review). The poolside bar was nice in the evening, though neighbouring building works were a bit of a distraction. This hotel allows late check out without extra charge which is a nice change to others in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, service, and food.”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, and was impressed by the service, quality of room, and the restaurant. Despite being on the second floor, the room was quiet and I had no problems sleeping. The restaurant is certainly one of the best I have experienced in this price range, and the buffet was excellent. Perhaps my only complaint would be the time it took to check in and out, this was slow by any standard.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon to Singapore - Park Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gib39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Royal Hotel on Beach Road for 3 nights as part of our Honeymoon before flying onto Koh Samui in Thailand. When we landed we didn't have a taxi transfer pre booked but there are plenty of taxis on stand by so don't worry about that. You can also use the MRT (equivalent to London Underground) but this involved many stops to The Park Royal Hotel. The Park Royal Hotel is mainly suited to people on business however we were pleasantly surprised by how clean it was and how friendly the staff were. Our room was spacious and cleaned daily and complete with flat screen TV, safe and air conditioning. The only downside was that the hotel rooms didn't feature a balcony to sit out on and relax while we were waiting to get ready. The hotel has a nice open air swimming pool, gym and bar area. Please be aware that the bar can be quite pricey on an evening. The hotel provided breakfast as part of our deal and the quality of the food was good with buffet style help your self options. The hotel also has a restaurant on site with which we didn't use as we ran out of time however it looked really nice and had good reports from fellow guests. The hotel has a business centre which can be used to access emails and internet but a small charge is administered. The hotel is only approx 10 minutes walk to the nearest MRT station which is the best method of transport to visit such places like Little India and China Town. China town is worth a visit especially at night along with the Tooth Relic Temple and also the Sri Mariamman Temple both only a short walk from the MRT station. Little India is also worth a visit, in my opinion nicer than China town and some of the shops do some excellent authentic Indian food. I think the Star Bar was the name of the Indian restaurant we visited and I must say is still the best Indian food I have ever tasted. Singapore is one of the cleanest and safest places I have ever had the chance to visit. Singapore has many local restaurants but also has the major fast food outlets including McDonalds etc. The quickest way to travel around town is by the MRT which you can get a multiday pass of single journey passes all of which is really cheap. They also offer a small refund if you hand back in the swipe cards at the pay points. We found that the best way to see and find your way around the town is to just walk. We would recommend vesting Raffles long bar which is only a short walk to sample a Singapore Sling and the unusual environment. The Singapore Flyer at the time of writing was the biggest Ferris wheel in the world is located in the main tourist area and again is within walking distance from the hotel. The Singapore Flyer sits directly above the F1 pit straight and excellent views can be seen of the track and surrounding sights. This area is also home to the recently built Sky Park Hotel which is in the shape of a ship. You can visit the top of the hotel for I think around £15-£20 for a stunning view of the bay and surrounding area. You can also grab a drink in the roof top bar of which prices are not as bad as I was expecting from a 5 star hotel. The hotel also houses a casino and many top designer outlets to the ground floor. The only thing we wish we had done was to see either the Skypark or the ferris wheel at sunset because the views would of ben brilliant especially with the town illuminated Drinks can be really expensive in Singapore ranging anywhere from £6 to £14 just for one drink but food is quite reasonable. We also visited Singapore Zoo which was outstanding and probably the best zoo I have ever been too. The zoo is extremely well kept and relaxing with many of the animals in easy view unlike some where they seem to be kept inside out of sight. The animal show which included many types of trained animals walking above the crowd was also quite impressive. We spend a good 4 hours in the zoo and enjoyed every minute and well worth the entrance fee. The zoo can be accessed by the MRT but this involves many stops and then a final taxi journey to the zoo itself. This in mind we decided on getting a taxi direct which the hotel organised and again it wasn't too expensive. The F1 Grand Prix was to be held the week after our stay and therefore the town was in the process of setting up for the event. Its was a really good time to visit to see them setting the lighting rigs etc up for the night race and even walk along the F1 track. The town has many 5star luxury hotels which are worth a visit was a relaxing drink or 3. However like I said before drinks are expensive so be wary but I would recommend calling into Fullerton's and Raffles to sample the luxury environment and have a nice meal on the marina. Clark Quay is also a good place to enjoy the nightlife with many bars and restaurants stretched out along the marina. This is where the river taxis and river cruises also depart so if you want to see the floating football pitch, Marina Sky Park and high rise buildings direct from the water. Clark Quay has a nearby MRT station but is also within walking distance so walking back to the Park Royal after a night out isn't a problem. The streets during the day as well as at night appeared very friendly with people willing to help visitors and nothing seemed to be a problem. All in all Singapore is a wonderful place to visit for a short break as part of a stop off to another destination. We stayed for 3 days but probably required 4, as we didn't get time to visit Sentosa Island and Universal Studios. The Park Royal hotel is a good mid ranged priced hotel and is relatively well located for the main tourist sights. We couldn't fault the hotel in any way and would gladly stop again if we visited Singapore in the future.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel with basic facilities at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: adilmirza
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Singapore my wife & I stayed at this hotel after our three day stay at the Mandarin oriental. My words what a difference between the two properties! Although it is a decent Hotel however there can be a lot more that can be done in terms of the hospitality that they offer. The hotel staff looked so dissociated with the entire process of customer handling that you start feeling a little unwanted sometimes. Overall the hotel offers you basic amenities like a clean & spacious room with wi-fi connectivity (you have to bargain while you book it to include it in your tariff). The property is opposite Arab street & doesn't offer you any breathtaking views. Our room had a view of the busy intersection in front of the hotel. The closest MRT station is also a little far away and takes about 15 minutes of walk. There is a bus stop which is just outside the hotel & if you know the bus routes it can be a little more convenient. There are many small street side restaurants & pubs just across the hotel which attracts a decent crowd in the evenings. However, it is no match to the famous Clark Quay area. The bathrooms are small but at the same time the rooms are sized well. The buffet breakfast is also ok but it does not offer you much to rejoice. We had a complementary wi-fi connectivity in our room and the internet speed was good. All in all if you are looking at a decent hotel with basic facilities, Parkroyal on beach road is an ok choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a business visit”
Reviews.Author: Larry7591
Reviews.Content: This place is good while you are on a business trip to Singapore. The rooms are compact and need. Housekeeping is excellent. However the breakfast option was quite poor. The selection for breakfast is very very limited specially for those who would like to have an heavy breakfast ahead of a busy business day. The wireless Internet connectivity in the rooms needs to be drastically improved. The St.Gregory Spa is good but it's a tad too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty surprise upon checking out ....”
Reviews.Author: Bapestatic
Reviews.Content: After giving it many thoughts, we decided to give this hotel a try, from our usual preference. Checking in was a breeze and got an upgraded to Orchid Club with our GHA Platinum card. The room was fantastic and the afternoon snacks and drinks are splendid. Really appreciate the helped given by the lady who checked us in on the 6th floor. Sadly, the lack of that one star really shows in this hotel on the following days. At breakast, one of the staff shooh'ed my wife to move aside, to let her to go through and my request for a carrot juice was taken with a frowned. But both bad incidents was erased away by the lady manning the egg station. Also, I must give credit to one particular indian gentlemen who rushed to our aid upon seeing us seeking assistance with our luggages. If it wasn't because of his fast reaction, I would've rated this hotel with one green blob lesser. Now, while checking out ... I was greeted with a nasty surprise in the form of a bill for my telephone usage. Why should I be surprised?!? It is because, before making those phone calls, I did ring up their operator to enquire if local calls are complimentary and the lady at the other end of the phone said, 'YES'. I really don't care about the figures on the bill in question, but what annoys me was that the two gentlemen standing behind the counter didn't borther to be apologetic even though i did explain to them that, "Your colleague said that local calls are complimentary!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MaggieSomerset
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and were sorry to leave. No hot water in room for first day but our complaint was taken seriously and we were moved to another room. Slept well in a comfortable large bed. Spacious bathroom, all necessary toiletries available including efficient hairdrier. Also provided alternative area to enjoy a snack and a drink to cool off. Not far from Raffles. We took advantage of two day ticket on Sightseeing bus hopping on and off at various destinations which made good use of our time in Singapore and also avoided too much walking in the heat. Bus stop directly outside Hotel. Taxis not expensive. Staff were pleasant and helpful at all times. Meals not cheap but enjoyable. Great breakfast each morning. Ate dinner in the restaurant twice but on one of these occasions there was a large group of young people 9not hotel residents)celebrating a birthday which rather spoilt the evening for us due to the extreme noise. However, we would recommend this Hotel for its location, comfortable rooms and obliging staff.

Reviews.Title: “Making a splash on Beach Road!”
Reviews.Author: Winton8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 3 night stop-over October 2011. Very friendly and helpful staff, concierge particularly worthy of note. Excellent large outdoor pool on 4th floor great for gently unwinding. Decor in our bedroom starting to look in need of updating/refreshing. Buffets both breakfast and evening dinner were good. Bar facilities were very limited. The hotel is near the Arab quarter but a bit away from main shopping area although city tour buses stop outside and distances are not great. Hotel good value for Singapore and would certainly consider staying here again, particularly for the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great location opposite Kampong Glam”
Reviews.Author: lizjak
Reviews.Content: Had a great four nights in this older but well maintained low rise hotel. A little bit further than liked from the closest MRT but still a comfortable 10 minute walk.Taxis are cheap. The pool area is very relaxing to cool off from the constant humidity and a real highlight. Note there is construction taking place next to the hotel. Noise could not be heard in the room and was minimal in the pool area. Be a little adventurous and ditch the hotel meals and head across the road to experience the many restaurants on offer in Arab St and Haji Lane and you will be pleasantly surprised. French, Egyptian, Iranian, Persian, Moroccan food is available. Further up the road you will find a hawker style food complex with about 30 delectable food stalls. Meals from $2.50 SGD!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeGringo
Reviews.Content: Company booked many nights there. Food way over priced and not too good. Room not too bad. Staff very inflexible. Had to leave early and had to pay for the entire stay. Even though our company uses the a lot (not any more). Too many good friendly hotels in Singapore to waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: edfromkk
Reviews.Content: Though I had spent one night, it was a memorable and pleasant experience for me. The room I stayed in was clean and comfortable. Service was prompt and with a smile. I will definately be choosing PARKROYAL again for my next business trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Want a great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ChangiAirport
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel,but this time we went with a group of friends and Family. Its in a great location to very thing and although the breakfast cost is a little more than we are use to paying i would totally recommend that you have it. The pool Area was also great to relax after the days running around checking out any of the many things to do in Singapore. Would i stay there again and he answer is A big Yes

Reviews.Title: “Couple of improvements would not hurt”
Reviews.Author: tatho7367
Reviews.Content: We have spent an extended weekend at the PARKROYAL on the Beach road. The room provided by the hotel was not suitable for 4 people. When we point it out to the hotel administration the only suggestion they made is to squeeze the 4th bed in the room where already was not enough place for 3 beds. We did not have enough towels and constantly had to chaise hotel administration that we are 4 not 2 people. Also our room had no wifi only a cable connection so it was difficult to connect MacBook or IPod to the internet. Besides our personal negative experience the hotel is modern, freshly renovated and the hotel has a nice spa and the swimming pool in the balinese style. The spa is partly overseeing the construction site but this should be over soon. The hotel is located near the arabic quarter and has a number of nice restaurants in the walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: JayChau
Reviews.Content: Today is my 2nd night at the hotel. Staff at the reception was very courteous. I was told at check-in that the room will be upgraded to a deluxe. I appreciated that. I am on a business trip. I have not have time to explore the hotel yet. I am out of the hotel at 8am and back late at night usually around 10pm. Being tired after a long day out, I find the room environment and amenities/facilities meet my requirement. As I came out of the elevator on level 5, I noticed the "renovated and new" smell all the way to room 580. Good selection of coffee/tea making facilities. Fast and free wifi in room. Good selections of TV channels. My booking does not come with breakfast for 2 person, otherwise it would have been a good value for money for my 4-night stay. I would suggest that the hotel provides 2 hand and face towels to complete the otherwise good amenities for a hotel of this rating. Another improvement to take note are the bath towels, they are OLD. Today, I noticed that one even had rust like stains on it. Apart from the small setback, I think this hotel is good enough for business travellers. I will be coming back to Singapore in November for 4 days, I would consider this hotel again, hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Justso”
Reviews.Author: justso78
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at ParkRoyal now on two occasions with complete satisfaction on both visits.The first visit we were upgraded because of a booking error This latest occasion we arrived at 6am and as the rooms had not been made up we were offered a place to shower an change, as well as afree buffet breakfast and coffee's. We fing the staff here very helpful and friendly and the front office staff go out of thier way to ensure total satisfaction. The hotel is clean has lovely rooms and is in walking distance to most areas you would want to visit. Bus and taxi services at front door for sights further away. Staff here are also very helpful with respect of arranging transport for you. Overall excellent! will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weeks stay with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: sputniknz
Reviews.Content: i stayed for a week with my three teenage children in a deluxe connecting room. The kids were in one room with an additional bed which was a bit squashed but they didn't mind as room was full of their shopping anyway. Extra bed was very large and comfortable just like the normal beds. My king size connecting room was spacious and the airconditioning in both rooms keep them nice and cold. Complimentary bottles of water and newspapers daily were great. Housekeeping staff were lovely and very accommodating when we requested another duvet. Kids loved the breakfast - fruit, eggs, bacon, waffles, fresh juice, chocolate fondue- a huge selection.. and was one of the highlights in their eyes. Staff everywhere in the hotel were very friendly and welcoming which my children commented on. Pool was spectacular and just ideal for teenage boys to burn off energy and refresh..never very busy and with plenty of seating. Free towels available at pool. Construction site next door never impacted on stay at all. Short $4 taxi ride to Bugis Junction and $7 to Orchard Road so location was not a problem. Would definately recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “Review from Mr. Igor Ozhyganov (Ukraine)”
Reviews.Author: ozhyganov
Reviews.Content: Excellent, that was my second time in this Hotel, and I am really happy to be the part of this team as a guest. VIP service for real money! Perfect location, perfect food and so and so... ! Just try and You will be happy as well!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacques v
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Orchid Club on the 7th floor. The room was well fitted out with everything I needed for my business trip, and the staff placed a wifi router in my room to accomodate all my iDevices! breakfast and cocktails in the club daily was included in the price as was laundry, newspapers and internet access. No other hotel in Singapore offers all these services for this low price, and then the staff make it all seem like home away from home! Definitly one of the best executive clubs I have stayed in around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room, so so location”
Reviews.Author: marinautama
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful rooms, it's not grand or too big, but enough for two persons. The service was excellent, the concierge was always ready to assist you the minute you show your face in the lobby. Breakfast was great but nothing to go gaga about. Location wise it's only so so. If you are ambitious enough or need to lose some weight you can walk to Bugis, but otherwise it's quite far. MRT station is quite a walk either, and if you want to go to Orchard you have to switch trains at Dhoby Gaut. In front of the hotel, you can find some good eateries, like Chicken Rice or Bakut Teh, but other than that this hotel is far from any malls or stores. you have to take a taxi.I dont mind staying there again, but there are many other better alternatives for the price I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Viking9
Reviews.Content: Singapore is very expensive, but our stay at Parkroyal on Beach Road proved otherwise. It was somewhat affordable, but the services were outstanding. Always with smiling faces. I definitely would like to stay at other Parkroyal hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not compelling”
Reviews.Author: divvy_l
Reviews.Content: Good location for Arab Street, although not really close to an MRT station. The hotel is aging somewhat inside the rooms but is certainly not terrible. The pool area is quite good for the area and is the highlight of the hotel. Staff are generally helpful. I would return purely because the location is specifically convenient to me, but it's not compelling stuff, nor is it bad in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Money, can't buy you happiness..., it did this time ;D”
Reviews.Author: NicoJW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Orchid Club, Membership Rooms, due to an extra pay raise, and, we were rated at 2550 Singapore Dollars for two nights, and, two rooms, it was a very pleasant stay. If you ever have the chance, do take it, the Staff, and, advantages at staying on that floor, are beyond my capability of describing. The experience over all was great, but, it may be too costly for some. I have never stayed in the Regular rooms, so I could not review that section of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Chong T
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week in the self service apartment. We found the kitchenette very usefull, twice we wonder round the markets and bought some food to cook. Sometimes home cooking make a change from eating out all the time. The kitchenette is well equipped there is even a rice cooker! The staffs are very friendly and efficent. The housekeeping staffs are excellent , all rooms are spotless.We have our apartment up graded with no extra cost .To us this is icing on the cake. Would definetely come back and recommend it to any body. By the way there is a nice little bakery on the first floor where the locals go, it is opened from 8AM to 5Pm, you can get steamed or baked buns for about $1 each. Their delicious pineapple tarts cost $10 per box .Check it out yourself ,you won't be disappointed. Overall we enjoyed our stay in Singapore,thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel close to Arab Street”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a combination of 4-star accommodation, in an interesting area of Singapore, at a good price - this hotel proved a good choice. The hotel is in a convenient location: a short walk from the Arabic quarter which is fun to explore and the Bugis Junction shopping mall (showing its age a bit now but with good cheap places to eat). Marina Bay and the Colonial district are also within easy walking distance. Other areas are easily accessible by Metro - nearest stops are Nicoll Highway (Circle Line) and Bugis Junction (East-West line). Our connecting rooms were clean and spacious and free WiFi was provided. The hotel pool and gym are set to the side of the hotel and reached by a long, rather shabby, corridor that makes you think you have taken a wrong turn. Once through that, the large pool with plentiful sunbeds and well equipped gym are excellent. There is extensive building work taking place next to the hotel but we had no trouble with noise while we were there. We did not eat in the hotel as there are many choices of restaurants and food courts in easy reach. The staff were friendly and helpful - when we reported a problem with the air conditioner it was fixed very quickly. We would recommend this hotel for its good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Judiper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our son. We took a couple of days in Singapore on our way to Australia. The hotel staff were very friendly, although nothing was explained much during check in. The room was clean and comfortable and our son had a rollaway bed to sleep on. Pool area & gym was exceptional, lovely changing area and pool. There was building work going on nexr door it didn't affect us at all. Lovely breakfast too - chocolate fountain was a highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Heatherki
Reviews.Content: Staff more than helpful and always friendly. Good location unless you want to be in central Simgapore. Everything either walking distance or S$10-12 taxi ride away. Plenty to see and do. Enjoyed our stay very much and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “loved every day of my 4 months”
Reviews.Author: Emil0uD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the serviced apartments of the park royal for 4 months and loved every second of it. the staff are amazing, the pool, restaurants, laundry services, dvd rental, housekeeping, room amenities - all just amazing!!! right by arab street which is great because when you have the sterility of singapore day in day out you can escape and even little india is just a short walk away. theres busses taking you to town every few minutes and the mrt stations are close by would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, as always!”
Reviews.Author: Raddisch
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at the Park Royal Beach Road for Business and Pleasure (at least 30 days a year) and I could throughly recommend it. If you have the means the Club Lounge Level is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PB57
Reviews.Content: Functional hotel with reasonably sized clean rooms, a very good gym and a large pool and pool area. All staff were very friendly. The hotel is just a short walk to some good cafes and bars in Ophir Road and Arab Street. Easy stroll to Little India. The walk to MRT at Bugis is also easy. We paid a good price and would stay again at the same reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Always Reliable, Great Buffet”
Reviews.Author: MargaretGargoyle
Reviews.Content: I always choose this hotel as it is on the Changi Airport side of the city and is well sited for early drop off and late pickup. It's just across the road from Arab Street and great shopping. The rooms have been recently renovated and are very comfortable with smart bathrooms and complementary water and tea-making facilities.
