The buffet meals in the large restaurant are terrific and good value. The breakfasts are especially good with personalised ordering of egg styles and endless choices of hot and cold food. Concierge staff are always welcoming. Unfortunately the hotel is currently quite noisy, especially for light sleepers, as there are extensive 24 hour working construction sites on both sides of the hotel. I was moved up to the executive floor and was able to sleep but had no hot water for a shower over my two days there.

Reviews.Title: “Good but I expected better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Rachel-P
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, pool and gym. Excellent location as you can walk into the main sites easily and get in from the airport by MRT. My only complaint is that the service desk/ reception staff were not that helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Boy-Nellie
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, good location, delicious breakfast, good restaurants for dinner. Very kind employees. We love to come back next year and stay a few days longer.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and recommended it to my Company for future”
Reviews.Author: sailormate
Reviews.Content: I cant write much about this one because this was one of those short stays in a hotel to enjoy it completely but can tell you this much I will surely review it once again as I have marked this hotel in my diary for my next stay in Singapore. So you can imagine it was amazing. It was one of those trips where I had not planned to book a hotel but due to some circumstances the company booked this one and I thought it would be one of those business hotels. But as soon as I checked in I realised I was wrong. The massage at the pool side and the pool were too good. The food was just amazing with the variety of cuisines. I am surely going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Sush1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 5 to 10 mins fro Marina Sands. Getting a cab is easy. We did take a bus to orchard road and it was about 5 minutes walk to the bus stop. As for the hotel itself, the check in was fast and the concierge was really helpful in keeping our bags since we arrived about 10am. Special thanks to Mohd from Concierge who was friendly and helpful. We stayed at the club floor, the rooms were clean and spacious. The bathroom was a glass panel however there is a curtain to block it out.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Optimistic12
Reviews.Content: We had booked for a double bed, but on arrival they told us it was subject to availability (this was not written on any of our documentation) we booked with our travel agent 9 months in advance, so we ended up with twin beds for the two nights we stayed. The hallway had an uneven floor and my husband managed to step into a dip everytime he walked down the corridor. The carpets were old and worn. Housekeeping were noisy at 630am and banged their cart into our door. However, the breakfast was great, heaps of options and the location was close to the MRT (5min walk) and nearby attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fantastic breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: PamNord
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Brilliant breakfast buffet (too easy to overindulge) - Fantastic executive lounge (delicious complimentary canapes and sushi provided during Happy Hour) - Great service (reception/concierge, restaurant and housekeeping) - Spacious, clean, well-lit and comfortable room and lovely bathroom - Complimentary 2 items of laundry per person if staying on the executive floor - Fast and free wifi in room - Great gym and large pool - St Gregory toiletries were really lovely - Convenient location (short walk to Bugis Junction and Little India, short taxi ride everywhere else) The Bad: - Window between bathroom and bedroom (while some may find this romantic, we find it disturbing) - Wasted balcony space as there were no chairs to lounge on outside - Insufficient shady spots around the pool (the best spot was also nearest the noisy neighbouring construction site) - Incredibly puny elevators (supposedly able to handle 10 people, but became overloaded at 5!) The Ugly: - Noise from neighbouring construction works near the pool (thankfully it wasn't noisy in our room)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DLArmstr0ng
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May this year for 8 nights and paid a litte extra to upgrade to the Orchid Club. It was fantastic right from arrival to departure. The staff are very attentive and went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed. The breakfasts were fab and the drinks and buffet in the evening was always welcoming and had a great selection of foods to snack on! The hotel has a great gym and pool and is perfect for relaxing! The hotel is very centrally located and walking to Little India and Arab Street is very close. We wouldn't go anywhere else in Singapore and have reccommended it to many of our friends. We can't wait to go back again! Dave and Linda Armstrong ( NZ)

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Barnabyfan
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the hotel even though we always stay on this side of Singapore whenever we are here for a visit and we loved it. Great location, quiet and in the greens across from Kampung Glam which is a very nice old Arab/Malay colonial quarters. A lot of halal eateries there too. Also close to the rest of the colonial district, Suntec City, Esplanade and Raffles Place and Marina Bay. MRT at Bugis is just a few minutes stroll across the street. Staffs were very efficient, helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. Check-in was fast and we most appreciated the concierges' friendliness, knowledge and help. Our room was spacious and well equipped and comfortable. It even comes with free wireless internet. As for housekeeping, we were surprised to see our room already made up when we came back from breakfast even though we were checking out on the same day. This hotel is value for money, and plenty of car parks for those who drove into Singapore. The only bad side we faced, we have a toddler and when we came back at night and he's asleep on it, it is inconvenient to carry the stroller up the flight of stairs at all the entrances, less to imagine if you are on wheelchair. Could make a ramp for wheelchairs and strollers.

Reviews.Title: “The fantastic service was the highlight of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: 255119Mel
Reviews.Content: The service was the best. Last time we came to singapore the service at another hotel was below average but at the parkroyal the staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and comfortable. They couldnt have been more friendly or helpfull, nothing was a bother to them. If you want to be treated to the best service I recommend the Parkroyal on Beach Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: victoriabitter67
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Parkroyal for one night and found the amenities and location very good. The check in was hassle-free and professional. The hotel is directly across the road from nice restaurants and is walking distance to Bugis Junction and other nearby shops. Unfortunately, the room I was given was right at the end of the hall, next to a room that the staff accessed (very noisily) from around 6.30 in the morning, taking trolleys and other equipment in and out, chatting loudly to each other, so it was difficult to get any sleep from this point. When I was checking out, I brought this to the attention of the front desk staff and they just looked at me blankly and so I just left it at that. All in all, a nice hotel, but if you get room 448, ask for a different room!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with a great swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: MikeLisaAnna
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Parkroyal for four days last summer while visiting Singapore as tourists. It is a nice upscale hotel with friendly service. It seemed like most of the guests were there on business, but we still felt welcome. The rooms are nice, but not over the top. However, they had everything that we needed: comfortable beds, desk, internet, good shower. The highlight of the hotel is its rooftop swimming pool, which had a very comfortable seating area where we enjoyed relaxing at the end of each day. There is a poolside bar, and you can get food delivered to the pool. The hotel's lobby was nice and bustling. There is a good restaurant, but we only ate there one night because of the many other dining options available in Singapore. The hotel is located about a 10-15 minute cab ride from downtown and 30 minutes from the airports, so the location was fine with us. Across the street from the hotel is the Arab Quarter, which has a number of good restaurants. There is also a Starbucks about a block away for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “loved the parkroyal back soon”
Reviews.Author: sonandsal
Reviews.Content: We are planning to return to the parkroyal mid August 2011. Lots of specials at the moment at other hotels but we keep on returning to the parkroyal. Weve been every year since we found the place on our honeymoon 6 years ago. Yes its a business hotel but was lovely for a honeymoon in Singapore. This is probably our 8th stay. Love the welcoming staff, the pool and we do use the gym. located near Bugis, clean rooms, Breakfast well...the best. Every now and again there is a deal with a free breakfast. Thats the cherry on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Parkroyal!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaK12
Reviews.Content: Parkroyal Beach Rd is very central, about a 20 minute taxi ride. From check-in to check-out I received the most professional and friendly service. I never had to carry my bags, which was a relief as I have a hurt shoulder. Going to breakfast was an amazing experience - make sure you're hungry as it is an absolute foodies dream! The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms include a bath, again something to look forward too after hours of flying or walking round Singapore - Parkroyal is close to shops, restaurants, internet cafe and bus service just out the front. I would 100% reccommend the Parkroyal on Beach Rd and I will look no furthur than to stay there on my next travels to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - Poor connectivity to other parts of city”
Reviews.Author: Sunil_Agarwal
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very good... it has a beautiful swimming pool at 7th floor. the stay at the hotel was pleasant except for the fact that it was pretty far away from the attractions of the city. We had to travel for almost an hour to visit any other place. The area around the hotel is very quite and calming.

Reviews.Title: “Ramp for strollers/wheelchairs.”
Reviews.Author: notiaida
Reviews.Content: They really should provide a ramp for strollers. Or rather, how will a disabled person with a wheelchair go up the hotel? The lobby is quite gloomy but other than that, excellent staff & very roomy accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: SaraGhavam1979
Reviews.Content: we've find the hotel on package offers by travel agency and checked it on Trip advisor to make sure that it was with reliable quality and it was. coming from Kuala Lumpur, we were surpirsed by the better quality of hotels in Singapore and Park Royal was also quit perfect in roams and location. great pool, great SPA and perfect breakfast having clean roam and bath. club downstairs was also well-known but the crowd was not bothering. Taxi Q will be bothering though around 6-8pm --> be aware. you can walk to some centers if you do have time and when you see the map you cannot figure that out.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Afield2020
Reviews.Content: We booked in advance and thanks to TripAdvisor.com, had free breakfast! So I think we got a great deal and we enjoyed our stay so much we ended up coming back for a couple of extra nights. Really great things: 1) the breakfast is the most amazing I have ever seen, from your choice of freeshly squeezed juice, eggs how you like it, to every taste for breakfast cuisine. Awesome. 2) the pool is lovely. You are in Singapore but feel like you're at a beach resort almost! 3) the rooms are not super glamourous, but are more spacious than most at this price in Sg 4) there are lots of eateries in walking distance from Subway to more formal dining 5) the MRT station is around the corner. Really easy to walk with suitcases if necessary. Not quite so fabulous... the corridor noise can be heard pretty easily. a plethora of hotel staff will begin knocking on your door from about 830 am for everything from minibars to picking up room service that has already been picked up to checking if you have laundry to housekeepers. I advise putting out the do not disturb sign and only removing it when you go to breakfast. Both bathrooms in the rooms we were in needed maintenance - in one, a tile was falling off. in the other, the water filled in the bath while using the shower so I think the drain needed cleaning. Internet fairly intermittent in rooms but good in lobby. The beds are very firm. I think the positives definitely outweight the negatives. I've already highly recommended this hotel to friends travelling to Sg soon.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money, will definitely choose it in next stay, clean&nice room, pool, 5-star breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rose_Mak
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for travel with family, very clean room and big room, the pool and pool side cafe are so clean, big, nicely decorated and comfy. Breakfast buffet is much better than expected and surely is of 5-star hotel quality. Staff at reception, pool bar, operator, 6/F are very nice and efficient. We've got complementary in-room WIFI. We took bus route 100 right in front of the hotel to and back from VIVO city for entering Sentosa. it's superb easy and we've got a chance to tour through Marina Bay area on that bus. Chicken Rice and Pork in Soup are a must-eat right opposite to the hotel. Will definitely choose this hotel again for next stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: chris813
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple times and next time I go to Singapore, I'll stay in a different hotel. The bathrooms are older, very small and no frills. Not terrible, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 5 Star service for 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: kezthomas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Royal on Beach Road for two nights as our stopover holiday from Singapore to Auckland. I'd read other reviews from Tripadvisor so was fairly confident of getting a good hotel but the Park Royal exceeded all my expectations. The service from the staff and concierge was always polite, fast and very helpful. The room itself was comfortable although the air conditioning unit was a little loud hence not quite the five stars. The location of the hotel is next to the arab quarter and only a 15min walk from Raffles and many main shopping areas, yet the hotel itself is very quiet for such a convenient location. As part of the SIA (Singapore Airlines) Stopover, this was rated a Category B hotel at our time of booking so only cost us £169 for 2 nights which was amazing value. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stop over”
Reviews.Author: PushkarNSW
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a good place to stop over if your traveling from Australia to Europe. Although the price of hotels have sky rocketed in the last couple of years, the weather is usually not too hot and the food is excellent. The Park Royal has an excellent pool area. The rooms are comfortable. It is a 5 minute walk to Burgis station and the trains are easy to master. It is a 30 min walk to Little India.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Hotel near Bugis Junction”
Reviews.Author: lapsaptong
Reviews.Content: When to go... I had a couple of days stay in Singapore for business and the company chose this hotel for me; it was super convenient because I had to do business around this hotel; the hotel features free Wifi which is very rare for business-style hotels, right? The location is not too bad as it is about 10 min walk from Bugis Junction (MRT & mall); just opposite from Arab Street area. The rooms and staff are nice as expected and the breakfast menu (using the Orchid Lounge) had a good selection. There is no chance to open the window and even I switched off the aircon it sometimes was a bit chilly; this is unfortunately often the case in South-east Asia... Overall, the hotel is decent for its price-class and everything was as expected. Avoid it when... If you prefer a boutique hotel with some charm then ParkRoyal might not cater to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great business travel experience.”
Reviews.Author: MandyMinsk
Reviews.Content: Located very conveniently to our office (less than 5mins walk) it is the perfect location. It is also a great hotel to relax and unwind and the staff could not do enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not good room”
Reviews.Author: donut4u
Reviews.Content: Other reviews here must stay in the parkroyal suites behind main hotel because we got a room on the 3rd floor which had very worn and musty smelling carpets in the corridor and was told it was quiet, really!!! a Room at the very end next to the utilities room, bang bang bang from 6.30 am, the room absolutely stunk, probably an overkill of deodoriser, though this did abate by the 4th night.dark, lighting not good. Service was excellent though . Despite being told by the concierge that the top of Marina Sands opens from 9am. The actual time is 10am. Happy hour at bar is worth it. Apart from the room the rest of the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service ever, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Objectively
Reviews.Content: The staff are the friendliest ever. The service is very good. Very clean rooms. The main bed looks comfy but the bed of the other room is not that comfy, but still ok. I highly recommend it. I stayed in the serviced suites.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - Amazing Value, Fantastic Service! We Will Be Back.”
Reviews.Author: princessbandicoot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two weeks from the end of March 2011. While it was a business trip for him, I was there for a holiday. I had originally wanted to stay a little more centrally at one of the big 4.5-5 star places (Swissotel, Fairmont...), but we ended up at the Parkroyal because it was almost next door to the Concourse building where my husband needed to be each day. If it wasn't for this, I doubt very much we would have ever stayed here - our circumstances have led to a great "discovery" and we will absolutely return to the Parkroyal when we next visit Singapore. As a total package, the Parkroyal on Beach Road is hands down the best place we have ever stayed. When I talk about total package, I am referring to things like value for money, customer service, as well as the general facilities, inclusions and location. The Hotel is 4 star, but it feels and looks like more than that. It just has a really impressive feel about it when you walk into the foyer. We stayed on the 7th floor in an Orchid Club Premier King room, which meant we also received the Orchid Club privileges. THE ROOM Our room was fantastic. It was bright, clean, cool and modern with good furniture, fittings and a nice balcony. It was a reasonable size - probably larger than a lot of other hotels were offering for the money. I actually would have liked some outdoor furniture on the balcony (even just a bench), but this a minor gripe. I guess the humidity and heat might mean that most wouldn't use it : ) I loved the rainhead shower - best hotel shower I have ever experienced - and the bath was also a nice addition. There were just a lot of nice, practical things about the room and the way it was set up that you don't always see. The cleaners did a terrific job, and were always so friendly. The bed was quite firm and the pillows quite soft. I think this has been mentioned by other reviewers. I was a little dubious to start with, but it was all surprisingly comfortable. It might not be everyone's taste, but it's a question of style rather than of quality. THE PEOPLE I honestly cannot rave enough about the level of service we received from the staff at the Parkroyal on Beach Road. From the moment we set foot in the place to the moment we jumped in a taxi for the airport, every interaction was so pleasant and welcoming, from the concierge to the reception staff to the housekeeping staff. It says a lot of good things about the Hotel in general - you do not get this level of service excellence from a poorly run establishment, in my opinion. I must make special mention here of the Orchid Club staff. They were wonderful and we could not fault them. I was surprised to read the previous review that spoke about one of the male staff members being unwelcoming, and honestly cannot believe they are talking about any of the staff we got to know over our two week stay. There were the simple things like the way they greeted us whenever we saw them - it was always with a smile and it always felt genuine. The level of attention to detail and the professionalism they showed really impressed us and really made it feel like a home away from home. These little things really make a big difference to being in a foreign country away from everything and everyone you know. In this context, it is worth sharing our experience at check-in. It was brought to our attention that the credit card payment for our stay had been declined (we were there on a deal that required payment upfront and this had been made by my husband's employer). While it was simply an error/misunderstanding with the setup of the employer's new bank accounts, it was a Saturday and impossible for us to resolve with them on the day. It could have been a highly awkward and embarrassing situation for us, but the Orchid Club staff member checking us in was gracious, understanding and reasonable in the way she handled it. She understood that we couldn't do anything until the Monday to get the employer to rectify the situation, and simply asked for a credit card to hold the first two nights of our stay until the rest was sorted out. Our booking was never under any threat and this experience really set the tone for the rest of our stay. THE ORCHID CLUB I have read varying comments about the value of paying extra for Club Room deals in Singapore Hotels. After staying here, we have no doubt about it (at least as far as this place is concerned!) and would do it again in a heartbeat. The actual Club Room is delightful. Comfortable furnishings, beautifully air conditioned (some may say a little too well) and pleasantly intimate. Breakfast is included in your privileges and you can either have this in the Club Room with other Club guests or on the ground floor in the main area with all the other guests. The breakfast served in the Club Room is a reduced version of what is on offer in the main area. There are staples, while other dishes rotate. There is a chef there each morning who will cook eggs, bacon, pancakes and a few other things to order. The Orchid Club staff are incredibly attentive and ask you for a coffee/tea order as soon as you walk in (and quickly remember if you have a regular order). We had breakfast here every day except for one where we thought we would try the main breakfast. It was also good and a lot to choose from, but we much preferred the intimacy of the Club Room. Also included are evening cocktails (including beer and wine) with finger food from 6pm - 8pm. This was amazing value and we were regular attendees - it completely exceeded any expectations we had. Every night we felt so looked after - as corny as it might sound, it felt a little like we were at our local at home and the staff knew us as regulars and what we liked to order. The array of finger food (lots of different, yummy things for all palates) was impressive. It was a really relaxing way to spend the early part of the evening before heading out to dinner. Other great inclusions were things like priority check in and out, broadband access, laundry (2 pieces per person per day) and refreshments all day. LOCATION I now laugh when I realise I was a little concerned about location, mainly because of reviews I had read on here. It is not an issue at all. Unless you are planning on basing yourself at a particular location every day (like Orchard Rd) the Hotel is highly accessible to most places given two nearby MRT stations and a bus stop straight out the front. It takes less than 10 mins walk to two MRT stations on different lines (Bugis and Nicoll Highway). Bugis is one station away from City Hall interchange and is also the nearest station to access a number of great shopping malls. If walking doesn't interest you, the Hotel is well serviced by a taxi rank. I only ever had to wait once. But, I really enjoyed the short walk to the Bugis area for shopping and the train so I didn't use it a whole lot when I was just heading out to shop. It is less than 10 minutes walk to Bugis Junction, which is an excellent shopping location. Straight across the road from all the great eateries in the Arab Quarter, accessible by a pedestrian overpass. In addition to this there is a stretch of shops along the other side of Beach Rd including restaurants, gift shops, bars, a hawker market, smoothie/juice place - there's even a Subway and Pizza Hut if you are craving something Western. SUMMARY Singapore is a great place with great people and this Hotel represents these things perfectly. When we visit Singapore again, we know we won't have to do any accommodation research! Would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for quality accommodation, great service, with all the perks of 4.5-5 star, but without the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back..”
Reviews.Author: LadyMephis
Reviews.Content: I have always love staying with Parkroyal and this time round, I thought I should checkout the one in Singapore. So here goes.. Check-in was breezy, they even upgraded our room to the Club floor - of course without the perks. But hey, we got a bigger room! All went well except for the receptionist who wasn't welcoming. He wasn't smiling at all and I wouldn't expect that kind of service from a 4-5 star rated hotel. Room: - Huge, plenty of space to run around. - Love the see-through modern bathroom within the room - Bed is so comfortable but a little to high to get on... - View of the Singapore flyer was awesome! Location: - At the hippest place in town, Blu Jaz and other cool hangouts @ Arab St just opp the hotel - Beach Rd Food centre (famous for their red bonesteak) is just 5 mins walk away - A few mins wallk to Suntec City & Marina Square

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: H_Talip
Reviews.Content: If anyone looking for a luxurious golden bathtub, bed for the royals, fancy sofa or probably an automated curtain, then my advise do not further reading please. After all, I am satisfied with their superior room. Whenever you're smart or casual, do not hesitate to head your way down to Parkroyal on Beach Road, a unique place to stay in. There's a hidden gem, awaiting to be explore! (Excellent Service) The hotel indeed has a great hospitality environment. These were proven from time to time, starting on our arrivals till departures. Admirable personnel such as the Doormen, Concierge Sam and Johnson and Receptionist Shane are truly an example. All of them shared a common interest, friendly, helpful and courteous. We're impressed. Generally, I would say that these people are diligent and outstanding in making our stay a memorable one! Thank you Parkroyal!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: siannoble
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. The staff were so helpful and polite, especially the concierge who told us how to get places from the hotel. The pool is amazing, incredibly big and really deep at one end (2.9 metres). It was lovely to go for a swim after a long day on your feet. Our room was a "superior room" which is one of their basic rooms, but was lovely. A huge king size bed, lots of room, a little minibar area, a basic tv, a lovely bathroom with a shower and toilet, and desk area. Two bottles of complimentary water were provided each day, and the room service staff were polite, though seemed to come at strange times (late in the afternoon). We slept really well here, even though the bed was unusually hard. There was construction noise at the pool, but not in our room on the third level. The local area, Kampong Glam is nice, Arab St and the Sultan Mosque are a few minutes walk. If you're looking for quick Western food, there is a pizza hut and a subway on Beach Road. I thought this hotel was lovely, don't have a bad thing to say about it. The closest MRT station is Nicoll Highway, which is about a five minute walk, go up the steps by the Concourse building. That station is on the circle line, but it is so easy to transfer to another line at Dhoby Guat. Another station on another line, Bugis is not a far walk either, less than ten minutes, and sometimes more convenient. It was really easy to get around Singapore from this hotel, even taxis were cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Considered of price, it is a good choice to accommodate in Parkroyal on Beach Road.”
Reviews.Author: KPChang
Reviews.Content: Very Kind of employees and good service. I was surprised at their knowing my preference when I checked in and kindly greetings to me as an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay (for anyone who wants to have a wonderful holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: Neri01
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and son-in-law made 2-day reservation for us on my husband's birthday on Feb.26th. and 27th. We joined a 3 1/2 hr. sightseeing tour of Singapore before going back to Turkey which was also arranged in hotel at a reasonable price. Staff were very kind and friendly. Service was perfect. Breakfast was delicious. We can just say that everything was wonderful. We appreciated our stay there and advise anyone ParkRoyal who wants to have an unforgettable holiday in Singapore. Thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Heav16
Reviews.Content: I had spent hours reading TripAdvisor feedback on various hotels in Singapore prior to our departure. Our travel agent in Australia had arranged hotels on our behalf and I was unsure as to what we would find. Our very early morning check in was completed quickly by friendly welcoming staff. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was very clean and neat with a firm but very comfortable king size bed. Our room was much bigger than we had expected and the additional space was appreciated. The bathroom was spotless, we even had a bath, lovely toiletries, slippers and robes were also provided. Check in staff arranged for a complimentary newspaper each morning. We noticed a problem with our shower on the second morning and the consierge arranged for the shower head to be replaced immediately. Buffet breakfast was spectacular and the variety of dishes was huge, please give it a try! I would be shocked if anyone could not find something they liked. The pool area was lovely, relaxing and very well maintained. Above everything else the staff treated us like royalty, this is not something that we have experienced before, this atmosphere sets this hotel apart from all others, it's something that money can't buy.. We were always greeted with smiles and "hello's" at every interaction. The doormen were so friendly, helpful and always ready to welcome you or help you out the doors. We were lucky enough to witness Chinese New Year celebrations with dancers and drums and the whole hotel was so beautifully decorated. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other travellers. Management and staff of this hotel should be so proud of the fantastic service they provide to their guests, We will certainly be visiting this hotel again on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel in amazing Art Deco town”
Reviews.Author: Swisslovers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find, being on the main esplanade. Our room on the third floor looked out over the sea and was spacious, well equipped and very clean. Reception staff were friendly. We ate in the hotel restaurant which had pleasant modern decor and also looked out over the sea. The food was excellent, if a little pricey. There was plenty of off street parking for our rental car at the back of the hotel. The hotel was quiet but immediately adjacent to the wonderful streets of Art Deco buildings so we were able to stroll out around the town and along the sea front.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JulietNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Decor maybe a bit dated now but spotelssly clean and lovely, helpful, friendly staff. We stayed there one night on the way to NZ and 2 nights on the way back on a SIngapore Airlines Stopover Package (incredible value) . We were upgraded to a de luxe room, (spacious with good bathroom ) and after we checked out the following day, we had some hours to wait before our flight. The staff suggested we use the spa facilities on the top floor where there was a pool, refreshments, showers and towels so we could freshen up just before we left. Again, it was spotless. Free unlimited hard wired internet available which was very useful. Breakfast was a very comprehensive buffet and we had no complaints at all. Hotel is situated near the Arab Quarter which is very interesting but handy to get to anywhere. Would definitely stay there again if we were in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: olavcsk
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel , most impressive gym i have ever seen in a hotel. Very kind staff , exellent service , short distance to all attractions. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Fairtrav
Reviews.Content: Location wise, this hotel is within walking distance (7 minutes) to the Golden Mile Complex where buses to Malaysia and Thailand depart and 4 minutes on foot to the Nicoll Highway MRT station (both on the same side of the road as the hotel). The Bugis area is 5 minutes away by bus. There are some eating outlets near the hotel but it is better to take the bus to the Bugis area for more food choices. There are bus-stops just in front of the hotel and across the road for those who want to go to the city centre. As mentioned before, the exterior of the hotel is a little dated but the interior is both trendy and very comfortable. It truly is one of those cases where you shouldn't judge a book by its cover. Staff were pleasant, efficient and very helpful. We arrived at noon and were immediately given a room although check-in time was at 1400 hours. Our room, unfortunately, was the one facing the lift lobby although I had requested for a room away from the lifts. The hotel was full so we had no choice. We could hear everything from people entering and leaving the lifts to the housekeeping staff pushing their trolleys along the corridor. It was disconcerting but thankfully we were out during most of the two days that we spent at the hotel. At night it was a little quieter because there was less human traffic. However, we could still hear guests talking as they entered and left the lifts so in the end I had to use earplugs in order to sleep. The room itself was spacious, clean and bright. There was cable TV with a good selection of channels but the use of the internet was chargeable (pricey, too). Overall, a good mid-range hotel in a good location for those who don't want to stay in the city centre but who want easy access to it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money~”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: Chose this for a staycation with some friends as they were having a 50% off 2nd room promotion for weekends. Bookiing was quick and easy and the staff in the reservations were very patient with some questions I had as well. The 2 connecting rooms (472 and 473) I had were honestly much better than I expected, and much better than what the hotel exterior looks like it can offer. They were very well maintained and adequately roomy for my group, and amenities were nice too. The only gripe is that the size of the connecting door was a tad too narrow and I would think that a larger guest would have needed to walk sideways to get through it. The location was not too bad for me as it was a short 15min walk to Suntec City but it probably gets tiring when you are trying to go back to your room with shopping bags etc. But there's a bus stop right in front of the hotel which is a option too if you don't want to walk. The pool side was very nice too, with a Balinese feel to it. The steam room was adequate but nothing fancy. The gym was surprisingly a good size too. I ate lunch at the Chinese Restaurant Si Chua Dou Hua on level 1 and the food was great. It was also fun watching the staff pour hot water for your tea with their fancy moves and pot. For the money I paid with the promotion (SGD380 in total for 2 rooms), it was value for money if you can disregard the slight inconvenience of the locaiton. However, I have some gripes during the stay too, which I feel the hotel should take steps to remedify: CHECK IN Upon check in at 2pm, I was told that only room 472 was ready and told that 473 will be ready approximately 3:30pm. We were quite okay with it and went into 472 to rest while waiting. At 3:30pm, the room was not yet ready, and at 4pm, I recieved a call from the receptionist informing that the room is ready and she will send someone to 472 to pass me the keys to 473. We continued chatting in the room and waited for the doorbell to ring. But what I saw instead was the key card holders containing keys to 473 being slipped / thrown under the door of 472. I just saw the thing sliding in and did not react in time to open the door and find out who that is. That is a totally unacceptable gesture by any hotel staff. It would have made sense if he / she has rung several times and done that after sensing that no one was in. But we were all in the room waiting and very sure we would have heard the bell. I am not expecting any grand passing over ceremony - I only expected at least the staff to have the basic courtesy and responsibility to pass me the keys personally. It was very rude and irresponsible of the staff, whoever he or she is, to resort to that. I was very upset and called the concierge to voice my unhappines, and the gentleman on the phone said he will reprimand the staff, but I was not given any follow up calls / answers after that. BREAKFAST We had breakfast on the morning of 2 Jan at 8:30am, and realized that alot of items had run out and were not replenished for some time. There seems to be a shortage of chef / staff doing the replenishment, and when it was done, seemed to be very sporadicly managed. It almost felt like you needed to be lucky to know what time to come in or risk having little selection to choose from. We and other breakfast guests were going around opening empty baskets and lids, which felt quite silly after a while. The restaurant probably could have anticipated the large crowd especially given it was a long weekend and plenty of tourists checking in/out and would have given me a better impression if that was managed properly eg. as simple as having more staff around. If I were a paying guest, I would be upset at having needing to pay but little to eat. The above being said, the rest of the staff I encountered during my stay were polite and pleasant. Worth a stay if you dont mind walking to burn off all the local treats!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Pool but Construction Noise”
Reviews.Author: OzSooty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about a year ago and didn't hesitate to book again. For a stop over stay of a couple of days the hotel fits the bill perfectly. We had a room with Executive Lounge access and this is well worth the money. The staff are excellent and the rooms large and the bed excellent. There is a major contruction right near the hotel, and the noise is very noticeable in the pool area - this was the case twelve months ago as well and it didn't put us off staying agian, but for a longer stay it might be more distracting. There is no noise inside the hotel or in the room. Some reviews have commented on the location. While it is too far to walk to the main shopping or entertainment areas of Singapore, it is close enough not to begrudge a return taxi fare. We ate in the hotel at the buffet restaurant only one night. It was quite good by hotel buffet standards, however, we prefered our dinner by the river at Clarke Quay and our more rustic experience dining in Little India.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stop over. Comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a proper Singapore holiday but, it is great for stop-over for shopping or just a rest. Pool is nice, the hotel is clean and the staff are helpful. However, the location is poor, there are no views, and there is a lot of construction going on around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFIQUE. READ THIS!”
Reviews.Author: Supercalikirasexy
Reviews.Content: 1st of all, i would like to say, DO NOT EVEN HESITATE to book this room! But PLS PAY a little MORE AND ENJOY THE BEST OF THE HOTEL! Stay at the executive floors. Dont stay in the superior or deluxe rooms. Pay abit more n stay at the executive rooms and you'll not regret it. Anyway, this HOTEL IS DIRT CHEAP compared to other hotels of the same rank n level of service they have to offer. I am truly amazed with the service n breathtaking view and the sleek design of the room. Yes the location may not be in the bustling Orchard Rd, but it's close enough. Come on, u're on a holiday, DONT BE LAZY, EXPLORE n walk ard abit! The nearest MRT/Subway station is Bugis Mrt. The hotel is close to the ditzy Haji Lane area. Something like a 'Little Arab' kinda place. Where there's lotsa mediterranean food n sheesha going on. But it has a certain charm to it. SINGAPORE is SMALL. everywhere is close by. U dont hv to worry abt travelling time. Just stick to taking the MRT/Subway or take the taxi from the hotel (just avoid taking the taxis during peak hours) PROS: Location. If u book the executive floor, your room would be situated at the top most floor, level 8 i think. and the view is simply stunning! i had one that is overlooking the Singapore Flyer n Suntec City and the lights from the view at night, is simply worth the extra bucks i forked out to get the best rooms (bear in my that the rooms in this hotel is MUCH cheaper than other hotels of the same level of stars). Service. The staffs are very accomodating and flexible. I had trouble checking in because of my credit card n the lady who was attending to me was very patient n professional. N if u walk ard the hotel area, staffs from the hotel were never short of smiles n will make u feel welcomed n u can actually feel that they enjoy doing what they do. (unlike some other hotel's service staffs whr u can clearly get the vibe that she dont wanna be there serving u or dislike working there. Cleanliness. Is superb. Nothing else to say. I feel like i walked right into a showroom. The room is BIG, HUGE, AIRY N ALWAYS BRIGHT! Definitely has a good vibe when u enter the room. Toilet. Is WORLD CLASS! Breakfast. Choices of breakfast is varied n aplenty! Checking in n Checking out was smooth (if not for the little incident with my CC, it wud've been. It's not their fault anyway. It's my bank's fault) Bed is very comfortable. Comforters were sooo smooth n crisp. Swimming pool is not indoors, it;s open air. N open till 10pm. Quite big. Of course not huge olympic size. Comes with free WIFI inside the room for those of u with Laptops. Just ask for the password n username. HAVE I MENTIONED THAT THE VIEW OUTSIDE MY BALCONY IS TO DIE FOR?!?!?!?! I'll definitely recommend this hotel to everyone that is hesitant. N will definitely stay here again! I've included some pictures, take a look to see what i mean..

Reviews.Title: “A haven of understated hospitality”
Reviews.Author: spysmum
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, which we have used several times before, has a slightly shabby, dated exterior. Once inside, the quality reveals itself, with an elegant lobby and reception, and efficient staff. The location is perfect, being close to the Arab Street area and |Little India both with myriad interesting small shops and a huge choice of restaurants. within walking distance are the huge Suntec and Rafffles City shopping malls, and the fabulous opulence of Raffles hotel is fairly close. Public transport is close by, with a choice of 2 MRT stations, and good bus routes pass by. By choice, we opted for an Orchid Club room, which was very comfortable, had wonderful service, a dedicated breakfast and cocktail hour restaurant, great laundry service, with an unobtrusive helpful top floor reception manned by the charming Alix and his staff. On the ground floor were a night club and bar and several restaurants, including an Oriental tea house and large restaurant serving generous buffet breakfasts. On the 4th floor level was a large beautifu Balinese style swimming poor with attendant spa and gym, comfortable rattan sun beds and quiet shady corners surrounded by tropical greenery. A bar served cooling drinks and snacks, and at busy times, a pool side barbecue is set up. This is a wonderful boutique style hotel in a city of superlative hotels, and provides a tranquil oasis in a beautiful busy city.

Reviews.Title: “More than the accommodations, the hotel's staff won me over.”
Reviews.Author: chocobandit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parkroyal for a business trip. I heard a couple of good reviews from colleagues who previously went there, but after having gone to a lot of hotels, I was not expecting anything spectacular. Check-in was very fast. The receptionist Patricia was very pleasant and welcoming. It was very nice to have a lot of Filipinos handling the reception area because they were very fluent in English and quite accommodating. Bellboys had also been very helpful, as my luggage came in only a few minutes after I entered my room. I got a free upgrade to a larger room, with complimentary internet access and daily paper. It turns out that Patricia signed me up for their rewards program for free, that's why I was getting more perks than usual. The only downside to this hotel was the limited breakfast and lunch selections. After four days of staying there, I could already predict the pattern of their breakfast and lunch menu. I'll end this review on a positive note - what won me over was the service staff. From the reception, to the waiters at the Brasserie, to the bellboys and housekeeping staff - they were very friendly and eager to offer help as much as they could. They definitely made my stay more comfortable than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience. VERY NOISY - upgrading of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonnywoosh
Reviews.Content: Was staying at the hotel for 2 nights last month, the hotel is carrying out massive renovation work. renovation noise goes on the whole day all the way to the nights. it was so bad i changed hotel after the second night . Room is clean and service is good but the noise is simply unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Paris
Reviews.Content: The Park Royal on Beach Road was not my favorite on my company's corporate hotel list because of the not so central location. I had to stay there three weeks while waiting for a visa. It's not right in the city center but a short bus trip or taxi ride away from Orchard road. However the Arab street and a mosque are just across the street (you have to take a footbridge). This area is a kind of "alternative" Singapore with plenty of little unbranded fashion shops and middle eastern restaurants where you can smoke shisha in a water pipe. Some of the crowds there are quite a bit grungy. So it is a welcome change from the ultra clean sanitized international shopping mall Singaporean landscape. My room was on the Club floor. The staff was extremely welcoming and helpful. I complained because I had one the few rooms on the back tucked next to the other building. It was very dark even during the day. I was promptly moved to room a room with a nice view on the Arab street area and the mosque. Nice! This Club floor room was very spacious and comfortable. Big bed and plenty of space to store your clothes and luggage. The bathroom is spacious as well and is separated from the room by a glass wall. You can have breakfast on the Club floor where it is more exclusive. The choice is limited but you can watch the morning news while reading a newspaper. It is very comfortable and the staff is attending to you. On the ground floor, you get the classic buffet breakfast with a much bigger choice but sometimes it was very crowded. In the evening the restaurant serves acceptable Western and Asian dishes. But if you have the time and opportunity you are better off dining at a food court or hawker's stall. The in-room service is quite good. The hotel is bar is hosting a bar that occupies a niche in the Singapore nightlife. It caters to ballroom dancers. So you get to see not so young couples dancing. It may not be your cup of tea but the bar was busy many nights a week. Interesting business concept, not trying to compete against bars in Clarke Quay or Robertson Quay. There is also a very comprehensive gym and outdoor swimming pool. The gym is part of a spa that is also available to paying members that are not hotel guests. That probably explains the high standards. The swimming pool on the hotel roof is very nice. You get a good view of the surroundings and can swim under a blue sky. So overall I had a very pleasant stay at the Royal Plaza on Beach Road because of the helpful staff, the very nice Orchid room, the gym in the spa and the swimming pool. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The usual, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: Took the weekend promotion with late checkout, the hotel is not easy to find actually, all tucked away. Perhaps we did not know where to find. Check in was rather quick, probably becoz the personnel did not walk us through the details of our booking. Not sure if we were given a room upgrade with the weekend promo. Anyway room was clean n neat. With a king sized high bed. Toilet door creaks, needs oiling, n we could hear the creaking of the toilet door of the room next door as well. Breakfast is the usual, no scrambled eggs, I suspected that the food was leftovers from the wedding the day before, still delicious no doubt. Did not try the pool n gym. But the staff there are friendly, ready to serve with a smile. Not a bad experience neither was it outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Really Surprising”
Reviews.Author: KaPh_10
Reviews.Content: Given that this hotel has a 4 star rating we were not expecting the style or service of somewhere like the Sheraton but we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed on the executive floor during the recent F1 Grand Prix and were very happy with the service and quality of the hotel. We have stayed at Novetel Clarke Quey and would recommend this over that. Parkroyal had good sized confortable rooms that were immaculately clean and the service on the executive level was exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble, if you needed a laptop they bought one to us. Cocktails and nibbles were great and the breakfast super. I am a gym junkie so a good gym is important and this hotel had one of the best I have ever seen. Overall the hotel is great value and close to the MRT station. We will stay there again on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on Beach Road”
Reviews.Author: klkh2002
Reviews.Content: I had a stopover for a coupole of days in Sinagpore on my way to Europe and I managed to get an excellent rate for an Orchid Room at the Parkroyal. Service at the hotel was terrific - very welcoming and friendly. They went out of their way to make me feel welcome esepcially the staff on the Club Floor. On the day of my check-out, they accommodated me as well as they could with a late checkout and even though my plane was very late, I was able to shower and change in the fitness centre. Free internet is always a nice touch. The hotel isn't the Fullerton but in terms of value for money and the value factor, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Orchid Club Rooms to enjoy the best for this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pink_akachan
Reviews.Content: Always book this hotel for weekend getaway because of the reasonable pricing and its location being away from the city area. I've stayed in their Deluxe Room and Orchid Club Deluxe Room before. Imagine my disappointment when I booked their Superior Room. It's a far cry from their Deluxe Room. I felt that their Superior Room is pretty similar to those budget hotel like Hotel 81, only bigger in size. Immediately upgraded my room after stepping in. Wanted to upgrade to their Deluxe Room but was fully booked. The front desk took her initiative to give me the price difference for their Orchid Club Premier Room, and for the price that I've paid, I am extremely satisfied. Their Orchid Club Premier Rooms are probably similar to those normal rooms in 5-star hotels but more value for money. They are not as expensive and what's more, you get lounge access. Breakfast selection at the lounge is not very good as compared to the coffee house, but they serve cafe latte and cappuccino, something the coffee house don't serve during breakfast hours. You'll probably need to pay about S$500-S$800 for a 5-star hotel but you can get it at half the price at Parkroyal on Beach Road.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: PCN11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the parkroyal for 5 nights as part of our trip to singapore and malaysia. As we were celebrating our anniversary, our room was upgraded. Clean rooms with all the facilities you need as most our time was spent enjoying the city itself. A nice swimming pool too! Very friendly staff, great breakfast buffet, convinient location - hotel shuttle bus service is very useful. There are hotels that are no doubt better but parkroyal definitely was good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “BEST, BEST, BEST!”
Reviews.Author: RobAhanes
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I've ever stayed in. You can feel it as you real home with friendly staff, high speed internet (Wi-Fi and Wired), beautiful building and rooms, and best atmosphere. It's near all places you've really liked to visit like Merlion and Flyer, even Sentosa Island. I recommend this hotel to all who desire Singapore as their own country.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: BexPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as it was a Pan Pacific Group Hotel and the hotel is in a good locating - near Little India, but it is very run down and expensive. There are plenty of other hotels for less and better kept. The room wasn't what I booked, was filthy (bar the beds) and stank. I arrived very late and dead tired when I complained about the state of the room and the wrong booking I was told they would change my room but would charge me for it as they could only upgrade me. The bathroom was falling apart; the bath was broken, mouldy and hadn't been cleaned along with the toilet. The wooden surrounds in the bathroom were falling apart and being held together with bits of metal and screws. The rest of the room was just as dirty and run down along with its paper thin doors that resembled plywood. This hotel must have obtained a 4 star rating about 15 years ago because it certainly doesn’t deserve it now. I have stayed in some rat hotels in my travels but this now is at the top of the list; pay the price and stay elsewhere!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic pool”
Reviews.Author: wanderer_au
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel, my children loved the pool-wonderful after hot/humid days exploring singapore. hotel clean, staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It will cost you...”
Reviews.Author: hchrisau
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dated, and in need of a bit of paint. Linens were old and stained, but the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The TV was an old, small CRT model. The room was plain and empty. The shower head was broken such that the height could not be adjusted. Everything was extremely pricey. Room service meals averaged S$30, and quality of the meals was poor. Laundry service was available at S$8.50 a shirt. Breakfast was not included. The pool was very nice, but the Jacuzzi is only available for $76 per hour. The steam room could hold no more than 1 person comfortably and had mold growing on the ceiling. I had already booked and paid, but staff insisted I provide proof of purchase as Expedia had given a discounted on price. Check in took well over 10 minutes. Staff were friendly, but unhelpful. Nobody knew of anyplace to eat around the hotel. Of course they were more than happy to offer us their lousy room service at S$30 per main...

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room with great location!”
Reviews.Author: Staxi
Reviews.Content: ParkRoyal on Beach Road is just opposite of famous Arab Street and around the corner of Bugis Junction, so you will always find a place to shop, eat and drink nearby. City center is in walking distance but MRT is just around the corner too. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and very helpful. Our daily breakfast buffet was always very good and some dishes changed daily, so it didn't get boring during our four weeks stay. There is a beautiful pool area and adjacent gym. On the weekends the pool was crowded with families and kids so it was difficult to swim my laps, but during the week it was almost empty. Gym is perfectly equipped with state-of-the-art machines. The room was very spacious considering the normal shoebox-sized rooms of Singapore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good services”
Reviews.Author: AndrewLiu
Reviews.Content: -lots of choices in breakfast -comfortable and large bed -no time limit for swimming pool, you can swim for 24 hours. -on 2nd night, there is one glass cup was missing in bathroom and personnel immediately give us 2 glass cups for inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Macrow
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights and I was pleasantly surprised as I had expected it to be more 'budget'. Hotel is well-maintained throughout, including the room. There is a massive breakfast buffet selection that caters for Asian and Western / Continental tastes. We received a 30 Singapore dollar voucher for the Chinese restaurant which we used and found to be decent value - the 'Small' portions are actually huge, though without the voucher it would be expensive. The pool area is lovely to have a drink at, though we did not use the pool itself. Location is great - 10 min walk from Bugis station and a large shopping mall with cinema, and 20-30 min walk to Raffles hotel and Suntec mall where you can get on the city bus tour. Our only problem was with the room card which you need to swipe in the lift to get to the residential floors. Our card did not work a couple of times and we needed to ask reception to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: Shewolf76
Reviews.Content: I was surfing the net for a hotel that offered a late check out as my husband and I wanted to have a stay-cation. I stumbled across the Parkroyal's great weekends deal which included breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children (we don't have children but this might be useful information for people who do) and a late checkout to 3 pm from $200 ++. It was just what we were looking for and we checked in after work on Friday night. Walking through the night cafe scene in the Arab street area already made us feel like we were on a holiday. The ambiance there with the shisas and middle eastern cafes instantly transport you out of Singapore. And this is all found a 5-10 minute walk from Bugis MRT station. At check in, we were pleased that my requests for a king bed rather than twin, non-smoking had been accommodated for. We had been upgraded to a club room. We discovered that this meant it had modern furnishings including a large LCD TV. The bedding was very comfortable and the room had various lightings so one could control the level of lighting that best suited them. The airconditioning was also quite responsive to the digital thermostat. The bathroom was lovely and a blind ensured privacy although it could be opened to look out to the bedroom for a more open plan feel. It had a separate shower and bathtub and the shower even had a shower seat area. The breakfast won us over. We have had quite a few buffet breakfasts but this one had a large variety as well as having excellent quality. Everything was fresh and the food was not oily, not even the bacon or crumbed prawns! It had a small local selection including curried vegetables, carrot cake and mee siam, dim sum in addition to japanese style rice porridge with pickles and condiments, salads, cold cuts, cheese, hot dishes such as chicken and fish stir fry, sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, baked beans, an omelette, pancake and waffle station, continental selection of pastries and bread and a espresso machine! I would definitely recommend the Parkroyal beach road for a stay. It may not be next to the tourist area, but it is convenient to public transport and cafes as well as the Bugis junction shopping centre and the price makes it an extremely good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: PratimaSandeep
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Park Royal, Beach Road, Singapore twice in Jul 10 for two nights each. It is conveniently located and well connected by all modes of Transport. Reaching the Hotel from the Changi Airport- Taxi, MRT, Bus Shuttle • Taxi - Just 15 minutes( S$18- 20) by Taxi from the Airport. • MRT( Subway Train) - Connected by MRT ( subway train) from Terminal 2 of the Airport ( S$ 2-3 only). As of now one has to change trains twice but it is rather convenient. Lifts are available at all stations in case one is carrying heavy baggage. The MRT Station "Nicholl Highway" on the Newly Commisioned Yellow Line(also called the Central Line) is about 200 metres from Hotel. • Shuttle Bus - A shuttle Bus also runs from the Airport which will drop you at the Hotel for S$ 9 per head; how-ever it takes a circutious route and could take from 45 minutes to an hour to reach the hotel. • Misc - For any information and advise, contact the Info Counter with a sigh " i" (in italics) and not the Transport Info Counter. They try to sell you the time consuming Shuttle Bus or a S$ 45 taxi. Taxi at the Airport Lounge Exit Gate is a very good bet and you get them in plenty Hotel per se • Cheerful Front Office Staff. Makes you feel good. • Take room towards the Main Entrance since you get a Green View. The rooms on the rear side face adjoining Buildings. • Clean, well furnished rooms; Toilets are good; Effective ACs. • Above Average and responsive Room Service. • Delightful and most helpful Conceirge/s. They give good and economically effective advice. • Travel Desk ( Rep of the Tour Coy and not an employee of the Hotel ) tries pushing his Tours. May not give other economical options. • Very strict on Security – You can access Room Floors only with your Room Electronic Key. Can go only to your Floor apart from Swimming Pool Floor. I had a malfunction with the Room Safe. A team of 3 people ( 2 from Hotel and one from outside the Hotel Security Company) having different powers had to get together in a Conference Call to sort it out with sophisticated Electronic Gadgetry. Made us feel very safe. • Convenience Store in the rear of the Hotel (adjoining Building). • They give a fairly good Exchange rate though some-what less from the one available at the Airport. • Nice Top Floor Swimming Pool. Muggy Changing Rooms though. • Overall Very Good. • Did not try their Specialty Restaurants. Across the Hotel The well known Arab Street Area with Bars, Shisha / Hookah Bars, Mid East / Chinese / American Food Chain / Pakistani Restaurants are all there. The food is good and reasonably priced. Cloth Shops, Dresses, Curios, Turkish Chandeliers/ Lights Stores make it a well remembered Shopping experience. Must visit Bashir Khan’s KAMPONG GLAM CAFÉ on 17, Bussorah Street. It is in the Arab Street Area. Delectable Food. For Dinner, ask for the Menu. Chicken Chops are to die for. Pratima Gupta

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: I have been wanted to try this hotel for years but never book them due to the restriction of number of person per rooms (3 max) but found out in june they offer a family deal of 2 adults & 2 children + breakfast. Book in the hotel web page, thought I book for the family deal but clicked on the wrong column. (the reservation page can be confusing) Called up 3 days after booking just to confirm but was told that I have booked on the wrong room. The lady on the other end offers to amend the booking. Like the honesty of the reservation officer, some other hotel would move in for the kill and tell you that the deal you wanted has been fully taken up, we now have another room but cost slightly more ........ I often also judge the age of staff in the hotels. This hotel employs more older staff than younger ones, which in my opinion provides better service, more thoughtfulness and compassionate. It is also nice to be served by man & women in their late forties to fifties, kind of bring back the Raffles/Good old days feel. Room is good and spacious even with extra bed, like the table which makes computing/work easy, Flat screen TV, nice beds. Lifts is kind of 70s with all the 70s buttons but serves its purposes. Breakfast is good, wide spread and happy with quality of food served. One of my problem about this hotel is the food, its near Arab street and with lots of restaurants around. But to look for a decent hawker centre or coffee shop to have a typical singapore cheap food stalls meal within walking distance is difficult. The agreesive red ants (5-6mm long) in the car park on the right of the hotel is a very serious problem and the hotel has to deal with it swiftly. Place my bag besides my car and more than 20 crawl up immediately to my bag, ran 12metres away but they were all over my arms within seconds. There is at least hundreds of red ants crawling over a 150 sqm space, on the roads and car park area. But we had a very good stay, good sleep, fully rested and its very easy to go to other parts of singapore from this hotel. reached Orchard road by car within 15 minutes. Will stay again. .

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stonysonia
Reviews.Content: The Park Royal is not so special. The location on Beach Road is great, since it is easy to get around. The views from the hotel rooms are not remarkable. For 3 days, I faced the car park building, and when I requested a room change, was moved to another room facing the street. Rooms are reasonably neat and clean, and has regular amenities. The corridors are dark and smelly. Breakfast is repetitive, and i got a lot of carrot cake during my stay here. The entrance and lobby is unimpressive, hotel staff seem to be in a world of their own.. Service at the Café was unimpressive. The captain was in a hurry to take his last order half an hour before closing, almost made us feel guilty for sitting on. Would not go back to stay, and would not recommend it to anyone either.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable for stopover”
Reviews.Author: familyoftrippers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable. The food was quite good and available when we arrived at 10.00 pm. Bit far from shopping precinct if that is what you are going for but a short taxi ride will get you there. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Opposite to Arab street - A foodies paradise”
Reviews.Author: BobbyBangalore
Reviews.Content: I was here with my wife and 7 year old son for 3 nights during my vacation in Singapore. I like this place for its location to city centre and the Arab street which is a foodies paradise. It also houses a shopping centre behind for small time shopping. Food was good and staff was friendly. Room was not very spacious but clean and had a good layout with a comfortable bed. Had bad experience with 1) faulty phone in the room that kept on ringing intermittently without anyone at the other end and never used to work when people tried reaching us. 2) Beautiful alarm clock with World timings that was set to wrong local time, we almost missed out first day sight seeing appointment with guide because of this. It is good gadget for international travellers in a hotel room provided it is showing the right time

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: happytravellers7
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter, partner and grandaughter aged 17months old stayed for 2nights on the way to Australia. Although the hotel is not in an ideal position for many of the tourist sights, it didn't pose a problem as taxi's were plentiful and inexpensive. The staff were lovely and as it was very hot during the day we used the pool area until early afternoon. The smoothies were particularly tasty and served by very efficient friendly staff as was the tea and coffee ordered around the pool. We ate in the restaurant one night and had an excellent meal and they were more than happy to provide hight chair and suitable meal for our grand-daughter. Bedrooms were a nice size with tea and coffee making facilities and were more than adequate for a few nights break. All in all, this is a very nice hotel but not in an ideal situation.

Reviews.Title: “our perfect stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: gunsham
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nites and had no regrets. the rooms were clean and spacious. bathroom was clean as well. it was easy to travel around singapore from beach road. The xmas deco was very plesant and nice. would definately reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: prettybullet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from what should have been a three day stay at the Parkroyal, but ended up being an eight day stay. I would just like to put on record how wonderful all the staff were at a time when everyone was very stressed due to the flight ban in Europe. Particular thanks to George on the front desk! They went out of their way to help us in every way possible, and reassured us when we were beginning to despair! As far as location is concerned, I think it is ideal. It is just across the road from the Arab quarter, which is very interesting to wander around, and there are quite a few eateries and bars also just over the road. A particular mention must go to The Blue Jazz, a quirky place with good food and freindly staff, and a Swedish cafe (which I forgotten the name of!) which sold lovely cakes and coffee. The hotel has a lovely pool area on the fourth floor, which is an ideal place to cool off and relax after a hard day pounding the pavements, and is about a ten minute walk from the Bugis MRT station, which gives you access to all parts of the city - and is quite an adventure! Well I thought so! In short I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: tjruth
Reviews.Content: Service was generally good. During our 4 night-stay, rest and sleep were uninterrrupted and comfortable. Location was okay. We don't regret choosing this hotel for our family vacation. There were only a couple of problems we encountered. First, it was difficult for us to carry our child's stroller upto the main entrance of the hotel. There is no provision for strollers or wheelchairs there. Second, the receptionist in the swimming pool area, did not provide us with a key to the locker area upon sign up. So after changing to our swim suits, we had to bring our clothes to the swimming area. Upon seeing the other guests with locker keys, did I realize that we should have one. So I have to go to the swimming pool receptionist again to ask for a locker key. She did not even bother to apologize.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neigh82
Reviews.Content: The service was really good, the room was clean and decent size, the location was good, the only bad thing was breakfast from here was pricey and there is no where close by to eat, other then that would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: RocketRobin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Parkroyal before and our Company often used to put people up there when they visited Singapore. Seems to me that they have upped their game recently, staff on Reception were very friendly and efficient, my room (4th floor) was very nice indeed, it looked like it had been refitted recently, great bathroom, spotlessly clean. I had a special package which included breakfast. I saw that other reviews were critical of the quality of the food - I'd rate it "reasonable", not sumptuous but pretty OK. If I was paying for it separately I might be more critical though. The pool area is very nice, beware though of the noise from the building site next door - as of January 2010 the building that was there has recently been demolished and what is being put in it's place will be a big one. As commented by others, location is excellent. Very easy to get a taxi to anywhere you want to go (or a bus). If you book on their web site - take some care. The best packages are not at the top of the page and there can be a lot of difference in the value offered. I had a standard room and I was very satisfied. The special packages that are sometimes offered are great value, the Club floor is very nice but you pay more. There ae some wonderful hotels in Singapore. The Parkroyal is a decent place that deliveres a good standard of experience for a mid-range price. If this is what you want it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel, but the breakfast fare could be improved”
Reviews.Author: mij
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks on business. Location: Quite good. Directly opposite the Arab Quarter and walking distance from Little India. $5-7 taxi ride to Boat Quay/Clarke Quay $6-10 taxi ride to Orchard Road. 10 minute walk to Bugis MRT station. Staff: professional and friendly Room & beds: Very good Gym, spa and pool: Very good. Breakfast: Below what one might expect for a hotel of this standard and pricing. Not a great range of food and of variable quality. Hot foods have often gone cold. Coffee is self serve from a machine and you have to wait in a queue when busy.

Reviews.Title: “great beds”
Reviews.Author: Skinner71
Reviews.Content: thought this was a decent hotel - got a very good interet rate with payment up front but was well worth it - good location right opposite the Arab quarter, close to the metro and bus stop right outside the hotel. room was big and one of the comfiest beds we slept in. Pool area was really good, made it feel like a resort rather than a bog standard hotel pool. have stayed in about 10 hotels in Singapore and would definitely come back and stay here...some people giving out about the restaurant i see...firstly never eat in a hotel restaurant, its always more expensive and never as good as local restaurants...and for the reviewer giving directions to McDonalds for 'American style' food - words fail me.....

Reviews.Title: “Ready for Meal Shocker Prices”
Reviews.Author: DiegoLena
Reviews.Content: As they say, your must be able to afford the insurance if you can afford to drive a Corvette. Well, you must be able to afford the prices of the meals at this hotel if you eat at this hotel. A typical American style breakfast will set you back a "mere" $26.00. Be prepared to pay in the range of $45.00 for a steak dinner. Also, hope you don't get a room on the second floor, if you do, be prepared to listen to the music coming from the dining/bar area; really noisy! If you are walking and are looking for American style food, leave the hotel, make a left, go to the second red light, make a right, and there is a McDonalds approximately 2 to 3 blocks with American style fast food at reasonable prices on the left.

Reviews.Title: “Promising Hotel ? - But can be improved further”
Reviews.Author: blackberrymaster
Reviews.Content: Been spending 2 nights with my family and young kids there mid of dec 09. Though i made the booking with confirmed king size bed, but ended up given a two single beds... reason given was, they run out of rooms requested. well, it's defeat their purpose of having online reservation based on that. been driving tirelessly so decided to take whatever room they have for us especially my kids run out of patience. Breakfast is good and just nice. swimming pool and mini jacuzzi is nice for my family as well. internet rates are very cheap too. Things can be improved: Upgrade the 3 lifts to bigger, it's too small. Be more specific in your online reservation of what has been promised. Rest are good and will stay again in future if the new MRT complete soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Start”
Reviews.Author: DicewDeath
Reviews.Content: Don't believe them when they say they won't take a payment off you. I was drained of all my cash after they lied and took full payment straight away! I'm sure this is illegal after saying they wouldn't! ...just for this reason - STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “nice value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: gudiya99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good value for money hotel. The rooms were quite spacious and clean. The location was good with most good places nearby.The restaurants were average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for some R&R.”
Reviews.Author: OzSooty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights just to relax on our way back from London. The room was excellent, very clean, plenty of room, a comfortable bed and great bathroom area. We also had access to the executive lounge which we used both for breakfast and pre-dinner drinks - very good. We didn't use the buffet restaurant but did eat at the Si Chuan Dou Hua restaurant one night and we thought the food and service were excellent. As was the tea room. However, its only a few dollars by cab to Chinatown, Little India, Boat or Clarke Quay and the hotel is right near the Arab quarter so you are spoilt for food options. My one negative comment is the lack of a quiet area for a late night drink as the bar area has quite loud music and dancing even on weeknights and the pool bar shuts at 9:00pm. My wife used the spa facility and while there is always a premium for the beauty options in the hotels, she thought the Parkroyal's facilities and treatment were excellent. One of the reasons we stayed here was the reviewers who commented on the excellent pool area, and we weren't disappointed. There is building noise in the pool area from the site next door, but it didn't take away from the pleasure of the deck chair relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Busby_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, went on a 5 day cruise then went back for another 4 nights. On both occassions we were given excellent service from all the staff, stayed in a lovely large room and had no problems whatsoever.
