On first time check-in we were given a room on a smoking allowed floor (4th) but as soon as I went back to reception, this was changed to our requested non-smoking room (5th floor). We did try out the restaurant on our second night and am sorry to say the food was dire. Fish in batter which was not cooked properly and tempura prawns on soggy spinach noodles totaly covered in a horrible sauce. Agree with an earlier review, the food's not great and very overpriced. Much better eating out in one of the dozens of restaurants of Singapore. However the other incident when I met a cockroach in the gents was immediately taken care of by a team of cleaners appearing. Very central location with short walks to the Raffles hotel and Plaza and to Suntec City. Difficult to pick out just one staff member for praise - they were all very polite and efficient, however well done Saini one of the concierge team who rescued our tour when the tour bus never turned up, and to the young guy in the well equipped gym who was extremely helpful. Would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - older hotel but worth considering”
Reviews.Author: NearRadwell
Reviews.Content: I booked a business room on the 6th floor at this hotel for a week in September. The rates were very good and the reviews looked good on TripAdvisor. Overall I liked the hotel and the staff were extremely helpful throughout the stay. The hotel is older and some of the fixtures in the room show a little sign of wear. However, the guest rooms and public areas were spottless. On arrival my shower was not working correctly. I completed a guest survey card on the first evening and by the second afternoon of my stay the shower was replaced. The duty manager followed up to make sure I was 100% happy with my room. Dining in the hotel at lunch and in the evening was okay but I was a little dissapointed at the price of the food and quality which was 3 star rather than 5. So I would recommend jumping in a taxi and eating out over the hotel restaurant. Hotel location is great. It is an easy 10 minute walk to the Raffles Hotel and the Chimes shopping area. If you are up for a hike you can walk to Orchard Street in about 30 minutes. Suntec City is a 15min walk. Guest rooms are large. Nice pool area and gym which is well appointed with quality equipment. So overall I would stay at the hotel again. Check out the rates for your stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, good location, perfect for leisure, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bilji
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Park Royal on beach road with my boyfriend and we loved it! The pool is superb, the breakfast is great, the staff is nice! We also stayed at the novotel on clarke Quay and the Ibis and definitely prefered the Park Royal! In a nutshell: - Fantastic Pool -Great breakfast -Professional staff - Nice location (Out of ERP) -10 minutes away from the subway The only thing is that building work is undergoing by the pool, such a pitty!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Mangosteen99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Superior interconnecting rooms with 3 young children. Our first rooms had a distinct smell of mould. We asked to move as one of our children already had a respiratory illness, but the hotel staff advised there were no other interconnecting rooms available unless we paid for an upgrade. We happily paid for the upgrade, expecting a far better room. The only difference between our old Superior room and the upgraded Deluxe one was a phone next to the toilet, bathrobes, slippers, a flat screen tv and a silk runner at the end of the bed! I would have thought all of these things were standard in bottom of the range rooms in Singapore nowadays. Still, our stay was fine and we had been lucky enough to get a sale price on our booking anyway, so even after paying for an upgrade, it was still a cheap stay. The buffet breakfast each morning had every selection you could want and was just as good as the Intercontinental and the Stamford Swissotel where we have stayed before. The pool at the Parkroyal was great for children and was nice for us adults to relax by. The frangipani trees surrounding added a nice, tropical touch. Bugis shopping centre and MRT is a 5-10 min walk away, so the hotel is really convenient to everything. Right over the rd from Arab St and near the main rd to the airport. Bugis shopping centre has a great food court on the 3rd level where you can feed a family of five , including drinks, for around SGD25. We will definitely be staying here again as our children loved the pool, but we will probably pay the extra for a much better room than superior or deluxe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: samjonk
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing bad to say about this hotel! We arrived at the hotel after a long trip from Melaka (Malaysia) to Johor Bahru, and from there with a taxi to our Singapore hotel. We booked 2 Club Rooms (with a special package that included a tea expercience in their Chinese Teahouse) a couple weeks in advance directly from the hotel website. The reception staff was very friendly. Our rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. Unfortunately after checking in to our room we experienced some problems with our toilet, but immediately somebody came up to fix it! The Club area was more suitable for business, than for leisure guests, but still the Club staff was very helpful to all of us, even my 12 year old son. We would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to visit Singapore, but don't want to stay in an overpriced hotel. This hotel is well located and very affortable! Thanks to Nora and all the other Club staff members we had a memorable couple of days in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel with decent location”
Reviews.Author: mensuno
Reviews.Content: Stay over a weekend break due to a promotion for Credit Card. Hotel locates at Beach Road, approximately 5-10 minutes walk from Bugis Train Station and Bugis Junction, a local shopping mall with good shopping spread, compliment with Bugis Village for night shopping and a nearby newly opened Iluma Shopping Centre. Intercontinental is just on top of that Bugis Junction. Parkroyal at Beach Road is only 4 storey high, with a famous Sichuan restaurant in the hotel, serving good chinese sichuan cuisine, popular with the locals. The lobby is of black tiles interior, so it adds a touch of class to this range of hotel. There are 2 lift adjacent to each other. The breakfast is also served at the ground floor at the left corner of the hotel, with a good american breakfast spread and considered quite extensive for the 4 star price. You would have a range of different tea range to choose from, from english breakfast, earl grey, green tea, camomile, etc. Also served different types of bread and eggs. Recommended. Before you reach your room, you may surprise that you need to enter its corridor with your hotel room card for the sliding door to open, and facing you is its long corridor at both ends. Do choose the non-smoking floor, since there are only 1 smoking floor. The corridor will fill those cigarette smell, if you are sensitive to smell. The room is a superior one, which they upgraded me from a standard room. Not sure what is the difference. But I guess is the extra sofa seating place near to the windows. The size of the room is reasonable, with king size bed and a flat 32 inch LCD TV. The design is contemporary with many wood. Lighting in the room is sufficient, and a working desk. Bathrobes, ironboard, slippers, hairdryers are provided, so this is also good for business traveller. Toilet serves with a deep bathtub, so it is good for a relieved sog. For facilities wise, they have a good size gym with well equiped faciliities, and a spa. However I could not find any water dispenser within the gym, so you might need to find your way for water. There is a large pool with lots of sunlights, good for sunbathers absolutely since it is all day with sun with little bushes. Wide area for sunbathing. There is a small bar for some fruity drink to quench your thirst. Overall, this is a good 4 star hotel, although you may need to walk a little more to reach the main shopping area. However, if you do like enthic taste of life, there is an Arab Street nearby where you can have a taste of muslim cuisine, turkish or Arab food nearby. You can even chill out at some of the pubs there with Arab water pipes. If you want somewhere not so crowded yet not far away from entertainment, this is a good choice for a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: MRPHILLLEE
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel as a two night stopover on our way to Australia. Unfortunately we could not relax in the hotel - it is a business hotel not a holiday hotel and many of the staff were overly aloof. However, on a positive note the pool is amazing and the concierge staff were friendly. The disco downstairs was just bizzare - the music blasted through the lobby, coffee lounge and into the restaurant. Not ideal at 1am when you have jet lag and just want a quiet drink. We intend to try Park Royal on Kitchner Road next time - Little India is fab!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillandSuePerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in july, we loved the hotel, its location is very near to mrt suntec and singapore flyer. The pool area is wonderfull as its in the sun all day and not shade like many other singapore hotels. We did not have breakfast included and we did not eat there. Our room and bed was very cumfy and we had no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Buffybelle
Reviews.Content: Excellent service through and through, and consistently exceeds my expectations. My first choice for hotel every time I go to Singapore. Great value for money! Great location - very near to Bugis Junction and to MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but needs to work hard to become excellent”
Reviews.Author: hedgefund007
Reviews.Content: The Parkroyal is well located if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle and yet not too far away, has everything you need , but is one step away from being a place you would want to repeat , esp if you are holidaying . It lacks that one little something which would make it charming and special . Rooms are comfortable - a little cramped though . The swimming pool and the spa are very good . We could only try the Coffee Shop and that too only for breakfast and that was very lavish .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Good amenities nearby eg. Boutique spa, pubs,restaurants”
Reviews.Author: DTGLOBAL
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel recently renovated. Strategically located along Beach Road so it is near to the central business district and shopping area and yet not in the restricted zone where we have to pay the taxi when we go in. Opposite the hotel, there are many restaurants for fresco dining. Also, there are many textile shops where we can do wonderful shopping. Next to the hotel, there is a nice shopping centre (The Plaza)where there is a wine shop, boutique spa and several amenities. Of special mention is the boutique spa (I think it is called RAINSPA) where we can have a therapeutic aromatic massage for as low as US$38 an hour. The environment is pleasant and serene. Good value for money. (see attached photo) You can contact them at [--] ..... In the wine shop, the list of wines are many and pricing is great. Had a great time tasting several wine there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabbitoh52
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with 2 friends last month and we were very impressed with the hotel's accommodation and staff. The dining room was beautifully decorated and served a really extensive buffet breakfast. The staff at the hotel were very attentive and friendly. The pool area is very relaxing and nice. Our room was a good size for 3 of us, didn't have a view but we weren't there for the view out of a bedroom. I would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone. It had a much better location than the one on Kitchener Street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: bassbin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights. Check in / out was painless and staff generally happy to assist. Room was on the small side but well appointed with LCD TV and importantly it was clean. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice and attentive wait staff. Pool area was clean and inviting (2 year old loved it - kids pool also). Location in my view is excellent (Opposite Arab Street precinct). Great food stalls and restaurants all around this hotel (cheap!), try the Moroccan restaurant in the mall in front of the Mosque, wonderful food / friendly owners and the local food courts down the road (turn right as you exit the hotel and follow your nose - we really loved getting amongst it with the locals). I would stay again and recommend to anyone looking for a good value hotel in Singapore, no complaints from us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: globetrotting1101
Reviews.Content: Everything was splendidly worth the money, from the prompt room service, to the view from my hotel room. There was internet access available in my room, charged according to usage and priced fairly reasonably. There was a table to work at, a sofa for visitors to sit and extremely comfortable beds.everything from the floor to the room was card access - which meant no keys to struggle with and the comfort of slipping it into my wallet when I didn't want to walk out with too many things. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy stopover”
Reviews.Author: ph8aus
Reviews.Content: Good size room with fantastic bathroom, good service and a great (if slightly pricey) buffet dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: sparts77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Singapore Stopover holiday back in March and found it to have been a great choice. When we initially checked in we were given a room with king singles and went straight back down to request a room change. No questions were asked and there was no hassle whatsoever and within 20 minutes we were in our ‘double room’. The hotel rooms were clean and roomy and there was nothing we could find fault with. Breakfast was fantastic! A buffet with so much choice and all of it looked (and was) tasty. Although breakfast wasn’t included in our package it was only about SIN $24 for two. Like the other reviewers have said – the hotel isn’t far from the MRT Stations and not too far (5 minute walk) from the SIA hop-on-hop-off bus. And a very cheap taxi ride to Orchard Road for shopping. I’d wholeheartedly recommend the whole Singapore Stopover experience to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PRICED SINGAPORE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dilux
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a good price and in a ok location approx 10mins walk to train. make sure you request smoking or non smoking. we are non smokers but were put in smoking room and was a little smelly. lovely lobby but rooms a little tired. the bar in the lobby has dancing every night and its quite nice to watch if you don't feel like going far from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ryan68
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Lastminute.com and got a great price for a Club room which included a buffet breakfast, cocktails every evening, 4 pcs laundry daily, early check-in and late check-out and wonderful service by the staff. My friend and I went on a one week shopping trip to Singapore and decided we would like to stay somewhere nice that included drinks in the evenings as drinks in Singapore are so expensive, we shopped around on the web and found the Parkroyal was the most reasonably priced. Loved the location as it is just out of the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk to the shops. Arab Street is directly across the road and so interesting to wander around. The pool area is fantastic the photos on the hotel website do not do it justice, it really is a tropical paradise up there. There is a happy hour every evening by the pool with half price cocktails but we mainly enjoyed our cocktail hour at the Club which served splendid wine from Chile or spirits if you preferred with a selection of hors d'oeuvres. The Day Spa is wonderful but quite expensive fortunately we were offered a $50 voucher with the Club Room booking and had a relaxing massage. The room is not huge but more than adequate for two to share, bathroom a little small but very clean and has all the usual extras required. Breakfast was great downstairs in the main restaurant with a huge selection and the Club room breakfast was more intimate with less choices but adequate. The hotel has a shopping mall with a Watsons chemist and a drugstore which sells drinks and snacks at reasonable prices no need to go to the supermarket. If you are only wanting to shop in Orchard Road you might find this hotel a little far but there are so many other interesting places to shop at and see such as Bugis Junction or Suntec City and it is only 5-10 minute walk to the MRT, taxi to Orchard Rd $7-$8. We checked it at 6am as our flight arrived early at no extra cost, the staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to stay in Singapore !!”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveling
Reviews.Content: We came from our trip to Indonesia, Bintan Islands and directly checked in Parkroyal at the Beach road, Singapore. (Not at Kitchener Road). Had already done prior bookings for Club room through agoda.com. Check-in was a breeze. There was separate check-in at the club level. Staff out there is very courteous and very helpful. The hotel is strategically located near Bugis street (10 minutes walk) for those who want to shop and opp Arab street for those who binge on good arabic food. Another good thing about booking rooms at Club level is you have access to the Club lounge esp in evening where you get complimentary access to evening drinks and snacks. Not to forget, daily 2 pieces of laundry being done for you per passenger. These things really help particularly those travelers, who are constantly on the move either for business or leisure. Most of places are very easily accessible from Parkroyal on beach road. Overall this was an Amazin Hotel and we had a memorable stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: MiMi&Sue
Reviews.Content: Having read some negative reviews I booked with some trepidation. However the hotel exceeded my expectations, and would definitely stay there again. Firstly the previous negative comments - noise and dirty room. The hotel was spotless from what I could see, certainly my room was. As for construction noise, there is certainly some around and it could be heard from the pool, but not from my room. I slept soundly each of the three nights I was there. Service was first class. I arrived at the hotel at 8am after a "red-eye" flight from Australia. All I asked for was the possibility of somewhere to change, but every effort was put into finding me a room, which was found. I was booked in and given free accommodation for the morning, so could snooze a little and shower before my first appointment that afternoon. They even found me a non=smoking room, which was something a five+ star chain hotel I stayed in 12 months ago couldn't manage. After that I found staff to be consistently friendly and attentive throughout my stay, better than the five star hotel. The room of course was smaller than the five star hotel, the carpets not as luxurious, and the bathroom and bath in particular smaller. But certainly not uncomfortably so. And of course very clean. It did face out the back, onto another building, but given the time of my arrival I didn't complain about that! If I was arriving at a more reasonable time, I would probably request a room at the front when booking. Breakfast was typical Singapore hotel buffet. The waffles and the eggs were very good, the bacon less so. A nice selection of fruits and I was happy. Coffee was out of an automatic machine that ground the beans and brewed under pressure, certainly much better than drip filter, but not quite true espresso. The pool was fantastic, and well maintained. Nice and deep at one end, which was nice for a hotel pool. Internet access was easy. It was charged for, but it was charged by the minute, so if you pulled the plug, or shut your computer the charging stopped. There was a daily cap as well. Reasonable charges compared to some I have experienced. I liked the location. Just a short taxi ride to the central attractions, there is also a bus stop for several useful routes right outside. Bugis MRT (underground) station was a "one block up, one block across" walk, certainly not too far so long as it wasn't raining. Best is that it is directly across from Arab Street, one of the most interesting areas in Singapore. I took several walks through this area, and ate there as well. However it does not sit on top of a mall complex, like city central hotels tend to do, so may not suit the avid shopper. It was also on the airport side of the city, which I like from an access point of view too. So yes I would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, five minutes from Sun Tec City, Bugis Village”
Reviews.Author: kiwinorfolk
Reviews.Content: This was the second time staying at this hotel and we were not disappointed. Clean, quiet, well appointed bedrooms. Very good buffet breakfast. Buffet evening meal good and value for money. Nice pool area, although unfortunately buidling work was going on next door, so noisy, you could not hear noise inside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stpover”
Reviews.Author: MigElec
Reviews.Content: Great place for a stop-over, very convenient ride from airport straight down the ECP, good if you are happy to be out of the central city. Have stayed here a number of times. Staff very helpful and friendly, rooms very clean and well appointed. Pool area/health spa/gym all outstanding with excellent staff, especially recommend a theraputic massage after any long-haul flight. Convenient to Bugis City & Arab quarter (5-10 min walk), quick bus ride further into town. Plenty of eateries round about . Be sure to specify non-smoking rooms if required

Reviews.Title: “I would rather not......”
Reviews.Author: OleMissTraveler
Reviews.Content: The only reason I have stayed at the hotel is because it is close to my office. I stayed here multiple times, usually for a week or longer. I quickly grow tired of this hotel. I stayed on the club level. This includes breakfast and happy hour. Both were ok, but very crowded. The food is ok with a variety of dishes from all over, but I would quickly grow tired of the club level food, it was the same everyday. This is expected and the resturaunts close by are excellent Location - this hotel is on beach road in the southern part of Singapore. You are only a cab ride away from everything. the Muslim is right across the street (beach road) and there are lots of great place to eat. Gym - great gym and pool. the gym looks over the pool area. there is never anyone in the pool, but it is still a good view plus you can see Suntec city in the back ground. Good machines to work out on and not too crowded. Bar - one bar downstairs. I only went there once and they were doing ballroom dancing. Good times... the room - OK, nothing special. I always found ants/bugs in the bathroom. Bed was ok. AC was noisy. Ok place, I would stay there by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to leave!”
Reviews.Author: NZandBack2008
Reviews.Content: Couldn't wait to get awway, it was to far away from the centre and the non stop drilling and demolition of the next door hotel was just too much!! We had enough, an awful stay. Maybe ok when the building work has been completed but not until then... avoid for the time being

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biblo47
Reviews.Content: We only had a brief stop-over here, but the room was spot-on, the service fine, staff friendly and breakfast was good. The location was reasonably close to Raffles hotel and shopping centre, a 15 minute walk. The hotel pool area was great, very relaxing place. After check-out we waited around the pool sipping drinks and enjoying the garden until our flight was due that evening. Staff provided free towels even though we had checked-out, which allowed us the chance to freshen up before the flight home.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: pinkybelles
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed at this hotel in 2007. it is in a great location within walking distance to the raffles and sun tec city. the pool area was great with a fabulous kids pool. the staff were fantastic escpecially the door people. breakfast was great, although drinks in our hotel were quite pricey. if we were to return to singapore I would definetley stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Was in town for the Formula 1 and had booked hotel a year in advance $200 per night a bargain as the people next to me were paying $500 per night but hey this is Singapore and thats what happens. First time here and was very pleased with what I saw. The rooms were big and very Ikea ish nicely presented and with a nice sofa under the window. Stayed in room 574 on the top floor which was very quiet even though it was facing the street and above the main drive. I slept well in the room but did wish the curtains blacked out the light a little better. As I was out all night and slept all day. Pool on roof is fantastic huge and with plenty of room to sit around it. For being so near the city center it was great to be able to relax. Breakfast was good and cheap and plentiful with very attentive staff. Even had a buffet fish lunch which had plenty of crab, shellfish, prawns etc. Excellent value. I have stayed in many hotel in Singapore but this one is my favourite for its location easy walk to town, Shops near by and ease of getting a taxi. This will be my new hotel of choice, Staff friendly and attentive and the cleanliness is not to be faulted. Only complaint is price of Laundry $10 per shirt. But if you walk through the shopping mall attached to the hotel there is a general store which does laundry for a fraction of the price. Over all a well worth while hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Rubber_Duckie89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a stopover with Singapore Airlines 2 nights each way. Was a good hotel. Our rooms were always cleaned and tidied well and as we were a group of five they managed to get us interconnecting rooms which was great! Although the bed when we arrived blocked the door which was a bit of a problem to start with. We had breakfast at the hotel which was great ; they had loads of yummy things including Singapore Noodles. The buffett was $22 but be warned if you don't want the buffett what you order because my Gran had toast, tea and cereal and it was $21! The highlight of this hotel has to be its pool - it is excellent, very clean and a great rooftop location as well! The sunbeds also had a kind of mattress thing on them so they were very comfy! Also in the pool bar have a look at the bowls on the table as when we went they had goldfish in them! The Hotel's location is good as well - not to far from the mall and the main shopping streets, and only a short walk from the Singapore harbour with the Merlion! All in all a very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendliest & Unhelpful Manager”
Reviews.Author: Eidan19
Reviews.Content: If u are are worried about the cleanliness of a hotel, this is no doubt the one that you can consider. It is very neat. However, if you would be concern about getting some assistance (for some reasons) from the supposed-to-be helpful staff, the Manager, I'm afraid you would be disappointed to get some extending arms and listening ears from the Manager - Mr. George Thong. I have stayed in this hotel for nearly 2 weeks. Overall, the room is neat but I am not happy!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Arab Street”
Reviews.Author: epicentre
Reviews.Content: The Parkroyal on Beach road is a good choice for people who like to be somewhere in the middle between downtown Singapore and the airport. Both are in easy reach with the airport being 20 mins away and Raffles Place around 10-15 mins depending on traffic. Located directly at the lower end of arab street you can dive straight in to experience the multicultural flavour of this city. The hotel is probably from around the 70s but being recently renovated it feels much younger and actually quite stylish inside. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Great value for money. Try the pool on the roof. I only found it by accident on my last day and wish I could have spent more time there.

Reviews.Title: “A place to relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: xyzn
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the doorman helped us with our luggages and direct us to the receiption. We checked in early coz we just change our hotel and on our way to sentosa Island. I did not mind if they do not have room since we will only be back by nite. To my surprise, they have a ready room for us. They also promised to place my colleague who was arriving in the afternoon a room near to us. Once back from the Island, only then we have the time to check the room. It is very spacious with 2 double beds. We were not even required to add rollaway even though we have our 2 kids along. It is entirely up to us. The amenities is way above commonly found 3/4 stars hotel. Everything was there, the iron and board, fridge, internet line, toothbrush and toothpaste, abundant of fresh towels, etc. All the used stuffs will be changed daily without request. The TV channels need a bit more improvement though. I bit more ASTRO favorite channels such as AXN should be added. The BF was nice and has variety. The only concern is the non-halal part. Nonetheless, we opted for eggs (made to order), fruits, breads, and vegetarian fried noodles or rice. But if u do stay more than 3-4 days, do venture out for the roti prata or nasi lemak in the restaurants across the street. The pool was adequate though I did not have the time to actually swim there. But my kids enjoyed it. They have a wading pool for the kids as well. The location though a bit far from the central place, it is only 200-300 m walk to a direct bus to orchard road. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel, not sure where the bus route is to, but can be checked in transitlink website. The nearest MRT station and mall is around 500 m abt 10-15 mins walk. The main reason we stayed here is the distance to our training site and the halal restaurant are just 150m across the street. Since I need to buy food for my kids in the hotel every lunch, this is a real bonus. Do try Mak Esah Cafe, their rendition of malay cooking is very close to perfection. I should know this since I am from Kuala Lumpur (the food heaven for Malay cuisine). Their price also is very reasonable (around SGD2.50 to SGD5.00). Beware of their satay though. I was not as good as it should.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and comfortable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: PerthMumof2
Reviews.Content: My daughter (14) and I have just returned from a week at this hotel. A word of advice dont turn right out of the hotel go left towards Ophir Road, you will find Bugis is just there. The mrt is very close and convenient. There is also a bus stop right outside the hotel, in the basement of the shopping plaza is a really nice bakery. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful the doormen were really nice especially. The concourse shopping centre has since closed. However Starbucks is still open. The room service breakfast was great and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Club floor review.......excellent”
Reviews.Author: sethlad2
Reviews.Content: We booked a Club Floor room as we were arriving into Singapore at 6am & the hotel was happy to let us into the Club Lounge at 7am. On arrival,we were checked in promptly,ushered to the lounge for breakfast & promised the 1st available room,by 8.15 we were in. 6th floor room had king bed & plenty of light with a leafy view across Beach rd,bathroom was fine with all the expected toiletries etc. Club included evening drinks & nibbles from 6-8pm,mainly sushi which is fine if you like that. Staff were helpful & friendly. Breakfast was simple buffet style plus eggs cooked by chef. Pool & spa area is outstanding,huge pool open til 10pm which is handy to cool off after dinner. This hotel is across the road from Arab St which is a wonderful,colorful area of Singapore & quite a contrast from the Orchard Rd experience.Great place to wander around or just sit & watch the world go by with a tea tarik or lime juice. Also a 10 min stroll from Bugis night market. We dont eat at hotels so cant comment on the restaurants but the tea house looked like a fun experience. Overall,we had a great time at Beach Rd & thought it was outstanding value for the price.We'll be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pool, nice breakfast ...........”
Reviews.Author: wychwood100
Reviews.Content: To be honest I booked this hotel with great trepidation after reading other reviews but I needed 3 rooms and it was Singapore Air Show week and this was all I could come up with! However, we arrived at hotel at 8.30 am after overnight flight and expected to wait until official check-in time to get a room. We had one room immediately so we could leave luggage and freshen up and the others we had before 10 am so I was impressed. Breakfast was lovely and probably the best choice we had in 3 different hotels we used in Singapore and Melacca. Pool area is very nice and the staff were really pleasant. It is true that it is a little further out from the centre but taxis are cheap and the MRT is not too far and feels safe all the time. One or two of the staff seemed a little gruff but I suspect that is the nuance of language. I guess that you could consider the room decor a little tired but everything considered (including price) I thought we had made a really good choice and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Singapore Stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuffers100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkroyal on Beach Rd on a Singapore Airlines Stopover deal, and found it to be great value for money considering it was in the second cheapest category. The exterior and lobby, including the pool area, are very nicely decorated in modern furnishings. However, the rooms are not very well decorated so be prepared that it might be bland compared to other rooms you are used to. Still, the rooms had cable TV and Internet, were very clean and had all the extras such as shampoo, toothbrush, and minibar. I can understand though how some reviews suggest that enjoying your stay may depend on the type of room you are allocated to, as they do seem to lack a warm ambience. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, and they were kind enough to give us an early check-in (6.00am) and non-smoking room. The buffet breakfast and dinner was fantastic (50% off using the Singapore Stopover deal), and the spread included a large variety of cuisines such as Seafood, Curries, Sushi to name just a few. The restaurant was very clean and nicely decorated. Suntec is within walking distance, but you will need to take a taxi ride to reach Orchard Rd, Sentosa, and Clark Quay. Taxis are cheap so the location isn't really too much of a problem. Overall, the rooms are ok, the staff are friendly and the dining (especially at discount rates) was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Essie16
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for business or vacation! Our room was well-appointed, modern, and clean. It’s easy access to many shops and restaurants: a 10 minute walk to Bugis Junction shopping mall and Bugis subway stop. Little India is also reasonable walking distance (about 20 minutes), as is the Esplanade shopping mall, as long as you are prepared for walking in Singapore’s heat. The hotel is a bit far from the main action along Orchard Road, so may not be ideal for true shopaholics. Cabs are easy to find and inexpensive though, so it wasn’t a problem for us. The pool area is really lovely and a great place to relax. There is also a pretty nice fitness center and they even had a yoga class when we stayed there. One negative: the hotel’s restaurant and drink prices were very high, so we didn’t eat there. It’s a short walk to McDonald’s, Toast Box, and a few other food stalls if you’re looking for a quick and cheap breakfast. We stayed at the Park Royal Beach Road as part of the Singapore Airlines Stopover program, so I don’t know the exact room rate. But given that package also included airport transfers and discounted or free admission to various attractions, it was a great deal. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: DougP
Reviews.Content: I booked through the asiatravel.com site. I paid SGD190/USD132. I was traveling alone and this is a bit more than I like to pay, but wanted something comfortable to get over jet lag from 18 hrs of flying from San Fran. I booked a non-smoking room but got a smoking room with a moderately bad smoke stench. I called reception and asked to be switched and they said sorry, nothing available. The room was a little worn and the smell was starting to bother me, so I called again and said I was having breathing problems. In 10 minutes, a staff member was at my door with a new room card. The new room had updated furnishings and no smell. It was very nice, nothing extravagant, just nice and comfortable and quiet. Everything worked perfectly and was spotless. Bathroom was quite nice, lots of toiletry products, clothes line. In room safe, TV, minibar and fridge. Staff was nice if not overly friendly. Elevators require room card. There are shops attached to the hotel and an ATM which is very nice. Location is ok but not the greatest. Arab Quarter is just across the street, there's an internet cafe minutes away and Bugis MRT stop is 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, good location”
Reviews.Author: bobabout
Reviews.Content: Good location with very good public hotel facilities and restaurants, although I was a little disappointed in the quality of decoration and furnishings in the room – these seemed to let the hotel down and I would have rated my overall stay higher if the room had been better quality. Staff were very friendly and helpful even though the hotel was very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parkroyal”
Reviews.Author: fussy_princess
Reviews.Content: My Husband organised this trip for my 40th birthday (only now getting around to doing a reveiw) I loved it , the staff and consierge were extremely helpful and freindly. A little bit out of the main area but taxis are cheap. Room was neat and clean ,and loved the pool area, only wish we had more time to realx by the pool. We had the full buffet breakfast included and i totally recomend that. Will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: KEMerk
Reviews.Content: Booked through Singapore Airlines Holidays. They always have one hotel in each category as a "Top Pick" which is available at a reduced rate, usually excellent value with breakfast included. They also provide free transport between the airport and the hotel and a one day Hop on-Hop off bus ticket. Parkroyal on Beach Road (or Parkroyal Plaza) is in an excellent location with Arab Street across the road and Little India a short walk away. The Bugis MRT is 5 minutes walk. The hotel has been renovated recently and of a very high standard with all expected facilities. The breakfast is good with a range of fruits, cereals, breads and some asian foods. A breakfast chef will prepare omelets. A package including breakfast is recommended because the breakfast is expensive. Speaking of expensive, anything not included in the rate tends to be way overpriced - $12 for a minibar drink, $15 for 30 mins internet access. However, Internet access is available next door for a couple of dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SRCWesternAustralia
Reviews.Content: The location was very suitable for my wife and I, good access to taxi/bus/MRT services, food and service was excellent, room comfortable/clean. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: AviD42
Reviews.Content: Change in travel plans forced me to stay overninght in Singapore. Since the Mandarin Marina (my usuall prefference) was fully booked, my travel agent booked me at this hotel. I never heard of it and beach road is a bit of walking from the central hot spots, but plenty of cabs will take you quikly to your destintation, and you get a wonderful hotel, good service, terrific room and bed, great breakfeast for half the cost of the famous 5 stars in Singapore. VERY GOOD VALUE

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay at the Parkroyal on Beach Road”
Reviews.Author: Lorz
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay at this hotel ffrom 22 to 29 October. Room was comfortable and spacious compared to others. The air conditioning was very cold and we could not reduce the temperature down - so we just switched it off when we needed to. We were given a non-smoking room as requested and we were most grateful that the hotel was able to give us an early check in, as we were exhausted after the long flight. We found the pool area wonderful and very relaxing and have no complaints about the service our loungers which other travellers have commented on. I used the Spa and found the standard high and very professional although cheaper prices could be found elsewhere. We found the location practical and enjoyed walking - even to the River Quay area. The Malay and Arab quarters across the road were interesting and Raffles Hotel, Suntec City, Bugis Junction etc within very easy walking distance which we enjoyed. We did not have a bed and breakfast rate and found the breakfast a bit expensive as most hotel breakfasts are. There is a Starbucks down the road (and many others within a short walk) so we had coffee there on several occasions. The Concierge, Mr Osman, was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pool”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Times
Reviews.Content: Just about everywhere has good and bad feedback. I went for this place for several reasons: LOCATION - Quiet enough but close enough to 2 major shopping precincts those being Suntec City & Bugis, TRANSPORT - 2 blocks away from Bugis MRT and VALUE. I shopped around for a great deal and got a night free. Some people complain that 2 blocks is too much walking to a train but I enjoyed the culture and sights along the way and was there in 10minutes. After all, isn't that what a holidays for? The doormen & concierge were excellent going out of their way for us and staff polite. We stayed in the room next up from lowest standard and were very happy with cleanliness, average size, complimentary products, decor, robes/slippers. The pool was an experience to remember with a bali tropical feel. There's a pool bar which also serves meals poolside. On the same level next to the pool is a Spa Centre which looked sooo relaxing and tempting and a fitness centre. In a separate room they run regular aerobics classes as well for you to join in on. I have to say that this was my 3rd time to Singapore and by far the best when it comes to accomodation of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking better than smokers room”
Reviews.Author: Gypsywillow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on our way to Rome. Initially we were allocated a smokers room which was dirty! Fluff balls sticking to the water sprinkler and air-conditioning vent, and it smelt bad. We are non-smokers so immediately rang reception who allocated us a new room on another floor. The new room was lovely and better maintained. We noted that smokers and non-smokers were allocated separate floors. The restaurant was lovely, as was the food. The pool area was large with showers, a bar and gym. We vacated our room at noon and were able to use the pool shower that night before leaving the hotel at 10.30pm. Our luggage was securely stored with the concierge till we needed it at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: RMW1
Reviews.Content: Well what a mixed bag of reviews! We booked a superior room for 2 nights and had a great stay. We did have an air conditioning unit which was a little noisy disturbing our sleep during the first night. We reported this, and were moved into a room which was a higher grade than booked. There are smoking levels to the hotel, so whether the smell was creeping into the non-smoking rooms as reported by other travellers, I am not sure; neither of the rooms we stayed in were tainted. Both rooms were modern and clean, the bathrooms appeared new too, so whether this hotel is being upgraded over time is unclear judging from the other comments - could be luck of the draw. The staff were very friendly, the breakfast was fine with plenty of choices, the pool area was excellent, though when the pool area bar man states he will bring your drinks over to you I would insist in just hanging around to be served yourself, as they are short staffed and forgot twice in a row! I would recommend the tea rooms too, a very pleasant experience. I would consider myself to be well travelled and have stayed in many 4 & 5 * hotels, I was surprised that this is a 3*, our experience was comparable to 4*, and we would definitely stay there again. It is only a shame that not everyone has had this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: OJP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a Singapore Airlines stopover holiday. Could not fault the hotel whatsoever. Check-in was very efficient including bags being taken to the room. Staff were all very friendly and helpful throughout the hotel. The room itself was large, light and airy and very well decorated with a lovely plasma TV! The swimming pool was great to spend hours in, with its lovely setting and the bar alongside. The hotel is in a nice area; it's best to get a taxi to the city centre or take the short walk (10mins max) to Bugis MRT. Taxis are very cheap and plentiful. Prices for food/drink in the hotel were above average compared to Singapore as a whole, but we found them to be above average in quality too, and still cheaper than British prices. Overall, we had a wonderful stay, and hope to be returning to Singapore and the Parkroyal on Beach Road soon!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs an upgrade!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jottie38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February 2007, having stayed in hotels in Bangkok and Koh Samui on this trip we were very disappointed with the Park Royal. The rooms were very dated, and also smelt of stale cigarettes, (we did request a non smoking room). The area in which the hotel was situated was not the best either. Would not go back to this hotel if you paid me!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Namdets50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as an extended stop-over from Australia. The hotel looks very grand and inviting from the outside, and the reception area is quite big, but could do with more seating. The check-in was painless, and our bags taken to the room very quickly. I was a bit dissapointed as the room was sold in the brochure as 'superior' when in fact it was just a standard in my opinion. That's not to say that it was not comfortable, on the contrary it was more than adequate and the service was exceptional - I reported a flickering light, and within 10 minutes it was replaced. Breakfast was included in our room rate, and we were certainly not dissapointed with that. There was so much choice, with a chef making pancakes and waffles freshly as you wait. Loads of the usual stuff with plenty of fruit. Finally I have to say that the free late check-out to 4pm rounded off a great trip, as we did not fly until 10pm, it was good to have the room late into the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RodneyAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the Singapore stop over deal. This was reasonably priced via this method and the hotel was comfortable and clean. I agree with another review it does smell of smoke and we specifically asked for a non smoking room which we didn't get. We did request adjoining rooms with a twin and a double. The rooms were spacious and the double bed huge and comfy. The bathrooms could do with a bit of an upgrade but perfectly functional. As our flight was leaving very late in the evening the hotel was very considerate in making sure they looked after our bags and that we had the pool and shower facilities at our disposal until late in the evening despite, having checked out (check out time was midday another bonus), this was a huge bonus with kids. They were also very proactive when our transfer didnt arrive for the airport. The pool is huge and lovely great for boistrous teenagers, they need more sun loungers as these are few and far between. I would book it again, but possibly next time would find something closer to the river and the quay.

Reviews.Title: “outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkbanana
Reviews.Content: We booked a orchid club room so we paid more for this so called upgrade on their average, but what a joke. The whole hotel smelt of cigarette smoke, the carpet was so badly stained we would not take off our shoes, the rooms were old, wallpaper was peeling off, the bathroom was dirty with rust everywhere - the toliet seat was even coming off. We wished we had not stayed here. Staff were very friendly although we had requested interconnecting rooms as we were travelling with two children and they told us they never received my email, nor my travel agents request of this and did not have any available. In the orchid club room you were entitled to free breakfast so we thought this was a plus, but the breakfast was horrible - the chef did not know how to cook eggs - ours were cold on top. The breakfast consisted only of eggs, toast, museli and some horrible white gluely stuff. The pool area was nice. The food was so expensive and avoid the restaurants, especially the Chinese one - it was digusting. We would not recommend this place and were pleased to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: pmta007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Superior Room at the Parkroyal. Booked through their website at a dear price (S$160/170 per night), so we were expecting a good product for the price we paid. This was mainly because we initially planned to stay at the Allson for S$70 less, but it was fully booked through a cheap booking site. We'd been very happy with the Allson in the past, so the extra we were paying had to be worth it. Check in was a breeze at the lobby, where we were offered warm hand towels. Unfortunately the staff were very cold! Nonetheless, we quickly had a couple of cards in hand and made our way up to the room in the lift. The hotel is very much a business-type hotel and all very modern; not well suited to leisure travellers. A note worthy of mention is that the hotel is very long and rooms are spread out, so anyone with mobility issues might have trouble if their room is down a far end. We arrived at the room, which quite frankly could've been in any city in the world. Ugly bed spreads, sterile lighting, impractical bedding for the climate (sheets and warm blankets), no real place to sit comfortably, and, I know it's pretty standard, but a shower over the bath. When I had a shower, water travelled all the way around the edge and down the side of the bath on to the floor. We had a flood! In all, the bathroom looked very dated. All this and a horrible view over the back car park. Later that night, we were trying to get to sleep, but it was impossible as there was a dull hum from an air conditioner in the car park behind. Luckily enough our request to change rooms was accepted without a fuss and we had the privilege of dealing with a delightful Indian woman at reception. And, while the room we moved to was identical, it was absent of any hums and had a nice view over Beach Road. And, of course, the bathroom floor was dry! The next day we ventured down a floor to the pool and spa area. If the only thing you wanted to do was swim, this hotel would be perfect. The pool would have to be the best I have ever come across, deep enough and plenty of sun loungers around. Change rooms nearby were both spacious and clean. We didn't venture into the gym, but it seemed to be well equipped. The location of the hotel isn't as good as many others in the city centre, but nonetheless, it was only a few minutes walk to Bugis Markets and the MRT station was about ten/fifteen minutes walk. Taxis seemed to roll by fairly frequently for those needing private transport. But, on the whole, if one wanted to rely on the MRT to get around, the location of this hotel would be less than ideal. So, in summary, this hotel lacks value for money in many ways. Rooms, location, rates and service are nothing to write home about. Rooms are uninviting and feel cold. Swimmers will love the hotel. But there are many better deals to be had at other hotels in Singapore - keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biff'ed
Reviews.Content: We stayed in plaza parkroyal for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon last April 2007. Booked hotel through an airline package tour First, there are a couple of other hotels with the name "parkroyal" so make sure you have the right hotel in mind if you are reading these reviews. This one is the Plaza Parkroyal, along Beach Road across Arab street. The structure: It is newly refurbished. Work was just finished i think last Dec 2006or Jan 2007 so expect clean carpets, walls etc.. When I was looking for a 3 or 4 star hotel to stay i kept on reading about moldy, damp, poor wallpapers about the other hotels. At least chances are you won't be having those problems here. Well equiped bathroom with tub.It is indeed a lowrise building so dont expect views of skyscrapers etc. Our room was in the front so we had a view of the hotel's driveway and an adjacent garden. Pool Probably the best in all of singapore. nice balinese type with a superb view. One will just wonder, it is higher than most of the hotel's rooms and you'll pass through a labyrinth making you feel you're lost before you get there but the pool and view is worth it. Food: Wide variety of dishes, omelettes,cheese, bread, cereal, fruits and salad for the breakfast buffet. If you're trying to save money, stuff yourself at 930am as brunch. After 3 or 4 breakfasts though, you'll find the buffet boring regardless of the variety. I guess this is the same in all hotels Location: On the eastern side of the city center. It is near the Arab street for those interested in handicrafts etc. It is near the exit/entrance toward the main highway to the airport. A small mall (The concourse) where you'll find a food court. A 7/11 is 2 or 3 blocks to the right across the street. Payphone and bus stop, just in front of the hotel. Hotel is near the DHL balloon. Bugis MRT and mall/night market, although near is still a 20 min walk - a tiring one if you will be with old people. If you intend to go to bugis or use the MRT more than once, you will wish you didnt believe the reviews that these are just a quick walk away. But if you plan to go there just once, then its OK. Money changers at golden mile complex 3 blocks away or at Bugis. (Rates at arrivals at the aiairport are comparable with downtown though) Orchard Road fafar - you'll need taxi or MRT Transportation The MRT is superb by the way, you dont have to buy the stored value multi use card by the way if you plan to stay for less than a week. There are virtually no long lines when you purchase or get the deposits for the MRT cards. If you plan to use buses too, then i suggest you get the stored cards. Taxis - a bit expensive with all the tolls and extras added to the fees. Bugis station is a long walk away. you'll realize that its indeed far if you'll see that other stations are really just beside the other hotels. If you plan on using a lot of the public transportation, the hotel's location is a bit of a problem Sightseeing SH tours one of the better tour companies, and the only one with a tie up with Singapore airlines has a permanent booth near the concierge so no problem with pickups, drop offs. Credit cards accepted. Malaysia anyone? One of the main bus centers of Singapore - Golden Mile is just 3 blocks away. We took the midnight trip to kuala lumpur, slept in very comfortable bus (take your pick of the various bus types/fares/skeds) arrived early am. took a trip to genting highlands in the am and went to petronas/KL tower in the afternoon boarded the bus and were back at Parkroyal at 11pm. A 24 hour Amazing race like sojourn but was well worth it.Walking the 3 blocks to and from the bus station at midnight was very safe. Can't say the same for Puduraya, KL though. Concierge/ Front desk Very helpful, just approach them. Facilities for luggage storage after checkout while waiting for your flight. Bottomline: Nice 4 star hotel (so don't compare it with the 5 star chain hotels), good food, superb pool. Use of MRT/public transportation a bit of a bother not unless you are familiar with the bus routes. Have a nice stay in singapore!
